fact : cast = Ernest Borgnine, Michael J. Pollard, Hollis McLaren, Louis Zorich 

In "Sunday in the Country," a peaceful rural setting is shattered when three ruthless bank robbers seek refuge at the home of a reclusive farmer. Little do they know, the farmer is not one to be trifled with and he takes matters into his own hands, holding them captive in his cellar. As tensions rise and the robbers face torture at the hands of the farmer, a gripping battle of wills unfolds. With a stellar cast including Ernest Borgnine, Michael J. Pollard, Hollis McLaren, and Louis Zorich, this intense thriller directed by John Trent keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for 1 hour and 33 minutes. Released on November 22, 1974, this English-language film from the United Kingdom garnered critical acclaim with an average rating of 7.8. As the farmer defends his home and family on that fateful Sunday, audiences are taken on a suspenseful journey filled with unexpected twists and turns. The film, produced by David Perlmutter, had a budget of 280.8 million dollars and grossed 209.5 million dollars in revenue. The production company behind the movie is the Canadian Film Development Corporation (CFDC).

title = The Sunset Limited 
overview = Based on the play of the same name by Pulitzer Prize Winner Cormac McCarthy, this searing two-character drama mixes humor and pathos while examining the relationship between strangers who are brought together by desperate circumstances. Set in a New York tenement apartment, the story focuses on two very different men - a deeply religious black ex-con who thwarts the suicide attempt of an asocial white college professor who tried to throw himself in front of an oncoming subway train, 'The Sunset Limited.' As the one attempts to connect on a rational, spiritual and emotional level, the other remains steadfast in his hard-earned despair. Locked in a philosophical debate, both passionately defend their personal credos and try to convert the other. 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
date of release = the 12 of February 2011 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact: correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h30 

In "The Sunset Limited," a gripping drama based on Cormac McCarthy's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, two strangers find themselves entwined in a profound and intense relationship under dire circumstances. Set in a New York tenement apartment, the narrative delves into the lives of two contrasting individuals - a devout black ex-convict and a reclusive white professor. Their fateful encounter occurs when the ex-con intervenes to prevent the professor from ending his life by jumping in front of a subway train known as 'The Sunset Limited.' What ensues is a riveting exploration of faith, despair, and the human condition as the two men engage in a battle of ideologies, each determined to sway the other to their way of thinking. With a runtime of 1 hour and 30 minutes, this thought-provoking film was released on February 12, 2011, offering a poignant and intellectually stimulating examination of belief and existentialism. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive

Set in a New York tenement apartment, the narrative delves into the lives of two contrasting individuals - a devout black ex-convict and a reclusive white professor. Their fateful encounter occurs when the ex-con intervenes to prevent the professor from ending his life by jumping in front of a subway train known as 'The Sunset Limited.' What ensues is a riveting exploration of faith, despair, and the human condition as the two men engage in a battle of ideologies, each determined to sway the other to their way of thinking. With a runtime of 1 hour and 30 minutes, this thought-provoking film was released on February 12, 2011, offering a poignant and intellectually stimulating examination of belief and existentialism.

In "Cisco Pike," we follow the journey of Cisco, a former rock star turned drug dealer who finds himself in a precarious situation when a corrupt cop forces him to sell marijuana for him. With the clock ticking, Cisco must navigate the dangerous world of drug dealing and try to sell the drugs to his friends within one weekend. Starring Gene Hackman, Kris Kristofferson, Karen Black, and Viva, this film promises a thrilling ride filled with twists and turns. As tensions rise and the stakes get higher, Cisco must outsmart the corrupt cop and make a decision that could change his life forever. Get ready for a gripping tale of deception, betrayal, and the race against time in "Cisco Pike." Gene Hackman and Kris Kristofferson and Karen Black and Viva are part of the cast. The tagline for the movie is "Gene Hackman and Kris Kristofferson and Karen Black and Viva and a footrace...a crooked cop...a lot of money and so little time."

In "Cisco Pike," we follow the journey of Cisco, a former rock star turned drug dealer who finds himself in a precarious situation when a corrupt cop forces him to sell marijuana for him. With the clock ticking, Cisco must navigate the dangerous world of drug dealing and try to sell the drugs to his friends within one weekend. Starring Gene Hackman, Kris Kristofferson, Karen Black, and Viva, this film promises a thrilling ride filled with twists and turns. As tensions rise and the stakes get higher, Cisco must outsmart the corrupt cop and make a decision that could change his life forever. Get ready for a gripping tale of deception, betrayal, and the race against time in "Cisco Pike." Gene Hackman and Kris Kristofferson and Karen Black and Viva are part of the cast. The tagline for the movie is "Gene Hackman and Kris Kristofferson and Karen Black and Viva and a footrace...a crooked cop...a lot of money and so little time."

title = City on Fire 
overview = Ko Chow is an undercover cop who is under pressure from all sides. His boss, Inspector Lau, wants him to infiltrate a gang of ruthless jewel thieves; in order to do this he must obtain some handguns; his girlfriend wants him to commit to marriage or she will leave Hong Kong with another lover; and he is being pursued by other cops who are unaware that he is a colleague.What is more Chow would rather quit the force. He feels guilty about having to betray people who have become his friends, even if they do happen to be killers, drug dealers, loan sharks and protection racketeers: "I do my job, but I betray my friends."To add to his problems, he begins to bond with Fu, a member of the gang. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['the description does not mention that the movie "city on fire" has a budget of 8.3 million dollars. therefore, my answer is: wrong.']
fact : budget = 8.3 millions of dollars 

In the action-packed thriller "City on Fire," we follow the intense journey of Ko Chow, an undercover cop facing immense pressure from all angles. Tasked by his boss, Inspector Lau, to infiltrate a dangerous gang of jewel thieves, Ko must navigate a treacherous path to obtain handguns for his mission. Amidst the chaos, his girlfriend issues an ultimatum for marriage, threatening to leave Hong Kong with another man. As if that wasn't enough, Ko finds himself being pursued by fellow officers unaware of his true identity.

Struggling with conflicting loyalties, Ko grapples with the guilt of betraying newfound friendships within the criminal underworld, where killers, drug dealers, loan sharks, and racketeers blur the lines between right and wrong. Despite his internal turmoil, Ko unexpectedly forms a bond with Fu, a member of the gang, further complicating his precarious situation. Will Ko choose loyalty to his friends, his duty as a cop, or his own moral compass in this high-stakes game of deception and survival?

Facts included in the final description:
- Ko Chow is an undercover cop.
- His boss, Inspector Lau, wants him to infiltrate a gang of jewel thieves.
- Ko must obtain handguns for his mission.
- Ko's girlfriend issues an ultimatum for marriage.
- Ko is being pursued by fellow officers who are unaware of his true identity.
- Ko feels guilty about betraying his criminal friends.
- Ko forms a bond with Fu, a member of the gang.

overview = The infamous story of Benjamin Barker, a.k.a Sweeney Todd, who sets up a barber shop down in London which is the basis for a sinister partnership with his fellow tenant, Mrs. Lovett. Based on the hit Broadway musical. 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
duration of the movie = 1h56 
Director = Tim Burton 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 
revenue = 152.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = Never Forget. Never Forgive. 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 20 of December 2007 
Producer = John Logan 
budget = 50.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact that the production country is united kingdom.answer: correct']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In the dark and twisted world of "Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street," Benjamin Barker, also known as Sweeney Todd, seeks vengeance as he teams up with the cunning Mrs. Lovett in their sinister partnership. Set in London and based on the hit Broadway musical, this tale of revenge and betrayal unfolds in the United Kingdom. Directed by the visionary Tim Burton and produced by John Logan, this English-language film was released on the 20th of December 2007, captivating audiences with its haunting tagline: "Never Forget. Never Forgive." With a budget of 50.0 million dollars, the Warner Bros. production went on to gross an impressive 152.0 million dollars, solidifying its status as a dark and unforgettable cinematic masterpiece.

title = The Voice of Bugle Ann 
overview = A Missouri farmer's (Lionel Barrymore) son (Eric Linden) loves the daughter (Maureen O'Sullivan) of a neighbor who has killed the farmer's foxhound. 
duration of the movie = 1h12 
budget = 49.4 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.0 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Richard Thorpe 
tagline = When love is young 
Producer = John W. Considine Jr. 
production compagnie = Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) 
date of release = the 15 of February 1936 
revenue = 83.9 millions of dollars 
cast = Lionel Barrymore, Maureen O'Sullivan, Eric Linden, Dudley Digges 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does mention the duration of the movie: "with a runtime of 1 hour and 12 minutes, this classic american drama explores themes of love, loss, and redemption."so, my answer is: correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h12 

In the 1936 film "The Voice of Bugle Ann," directed by Richard Thorpe, a heart-wrenching tale unfolds in the rural landscapes of Missouri. The story follows a farmer, portrayed by Lionel Barrymore, whose world is turned upside down when his beloved foxhound is killed by a neighbor. Amidst this turmoil, his son, played by Eric Linden, finds himself entangled in a forbidden romance with the neighbor's daughter, portrayed by Maureen O'Sullivan. As tensions rise between the two families, secrets are revealed, and loyalties are tested. With a runtime of 1 hour and 12 minutes, this classic American drama explores themes of love, loss, and redemption. "The Voice of Bugle Ann" received critical acclaim with an average rating of 7.0 and was a commercial success, grossing $83.9 million at the box office against a budget of $49.4 million. The film, produced by John W. Considine Jr. under Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM), was released on February 15, 1936, captivating audiences with its poignant narrative and stellar performances by Dudley Digges alongside the talented main cast. The tagline "When love is young" perfectly encapsulates the emotional core of this timeless cinematic masterpiece.

title = Maria Full of Grace 
overview = A pregnant Colombian teenager becomes a drug mule to make some desperately needed money for her family. 
budget = 293.4 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = Spanish 
revenue = 89.6 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Ecuador 
date of release = the 18 of January 2004 
tagline = Based on 10,000 true stories. 
production compagnie = Fine Line Features 
cast = Catalina Sandino Moreno, Guilied Lopez, Yenny Paola Vega, John Álex Toro 
duration of the movie = 1h41 
average note = 6.9 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact:answer: correct']
fact : budget = 293.4 millions of dollars 

In the gripping drama "Maria Full of Grace," a pregnant Colombian teenager finds herself in a dire financial situation and makes a risky decision to become a drug mule. Released on the 18th of January 2004, this Spanish-language film, based on 10,000 true stories, takes viewers on a harrowing journey through the world of drug trafficking. Led by a talented cast including Catalina Sandino Moreno, Guilied Lopez, Yenny Paola Vega, and John Álex Toro, the movie runs for 1 hour and 41 minutes and received an average rating of 6.9. Produced by Fine Line Features in Ecuador, the film had a budget of 293.4 million dollars and grossed 89.6 million dollars at the box office.

In the gripping drama "Maria Full of Grace," a pregnant Colombian teenager finds herself in a dire financial situation and makes a risky decision to become a drug mule. Released on the 18th of January 2004, this Spanish-language film, based on 10,000 true stories, takes viewers on a harrowing journey through the world of drug trafficking. Led by a talented cast including Catalina Sandino Moreno, Guilied Lopez, Yenny Paola Vega, and John Álex Toro, the movie runs for 1 hour and 41 minutes and received an average rating of 6.9. Produced by Fine Line Features in Ecuador, the film had a budget of 293.4 million dollars and grossed 89.6 million dollars at the box office. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive

In "Nine Lives," a stuffy businessman, portrayed by Kevin Spacey, experiences a bizarre twist of fate when he becomes trapped inside the body of his family's cat. Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, this heartwarming comedy explores the challenges and adventures that ensue as the protagonist navigates life from a feline perspective. With a budget of 30.0 million dollars, this film was released on the 3rd of August 2016 and runs for 1 hour and 27 minutes. Alongside Spacey, the talented cast includes Christopher Walken, Malina Weissman, and Robbie Amell. With an average rating of 5.5, "Nine Lives" promises a purrfectly entertaining experience for viewers, as depicted by its tagline, "His life just got put on paws."

title = The Curse of the Werewolf 
overview = Throughout his upbringing unnatural phenomena surrounded Leon. He is plagued with a terrible curse over which he exercises no control. During the full moon he changes into a ferocious beast initiating an orgy of indiscriminate killing. His love for Christina enables Leon to suppress his lycanthropic feelings until the engagement is broken off which precipitates a tragic conclusion. 
Director = Terence Fisher 
budget = 42.4 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.5 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = HALF-MAN... HALF-WOLF... COMPELLED BY THE HIDEOUS CURSE OF HIS EVIL BIRTH TO DESTROY - EVEN THOSE WHO LOVED HIM! 
revenue = 102.4 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h33 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
date of release = the 1 of May 1961 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is: [director = terence fisher] and the description is:the description clearly states that "in \'the curse of the werewolf,\' directed by **terence fisher**...". therefore, i would answer: **correct**. the description does indeed mention terence fisher as the director of the film "the curse of the werewolf".']
fact : Director = Terence Fisher 

In "The Curse of the Werewolf," directed by Terence Fisher, we are taken on a chilling journey into the life of Leon, a man plagued by a terrible curse he cannot control. Leon transforms into a ferocious beast during the full moon, unleashing a spree of brutal killings. Only his love for Christina allows him to suppress his lycanthropic urges, until their engagement is broken off, leading to a tragic climax. Set in the United Kingdom, this English-language film was released on the 1st of May 1961. With a budget of 42.4 million dollars, the movie went on to earn 102.4 million dollars at the box office. The tagline "HALF-MAN... HALF-WOLF... COMPELLED BY THE HIDEOUS CURSE OF HIS EVIL BIRTH TO DESTROY - EVEN THOSE WHO LOVED HIM!" perfectly encapsulates the horror and tragedy that unfolds in this 1 hour and 33-minute long tale. With an average rating of 6.5, this classic werewolf story is sure to leave viewers on the edge of their seats.

COMPELLED BY THE HIDEOUS CURSE OF HIS EVIL BIRTH TO DESTROY - EVEN THOSE WHO LOVED HIM!" perfectly encapsulates the horror and tragedy that unfolds in this 1 hour and 33-minute long tale. With an average rating of 6.5, this classic werewolf story is sure to leave viewers on the edge of their seats.

title = The Godfather 
overview = Spanning the years 1945 to 1955, a chronicle of the fictional Italian-American Corleone crime family. When organized crime family patriarch, Vito Corleone barely survives an attempt on his life, his youngest son, Michael steps in to take care of the would-be killers, launching a campaign of bloody revenge. 
Director = Francis Ford Coppola 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 245.1 millions of dollars 
budget = 6.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, Richard S. Castellano 
average note = 8.5 
date of release = the 14 of March 1972 
Producer = Albert S. Ruddy 
tagline = An offer you can't refuse. 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
duration of the movie = 2h55 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the description mentions that the director is francis ford coppola.']
fact : Director = Francis Ford Coppola 

In the classic film "The Godfather," directed by Francis Ford Coppola and produced by Albert S. Ruddy, viewers are taken on a journey through the years 1945 to 1955, following the fictional Italian-American Corleone crime family. After surviving an assassination attempt, family patriarch Vito Corleone's youngest son, Michael, steps up to seek vengeance against those responsible, leading to a brutal campaign of retribution. Starring Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, and Richard S. Castellano, this iconic movie was released on the 14th of March 1972 and received an average rating of 8.5. With a budget of 6.0 million dollars, "The Godfather" went on to generate a revenue of 245.1 million dollars, making it a massive success for Paramount Pictures. The tagline "An offer you can't refuse" perfectly captures the essence of this epic 2 hours and 55 minutes long masterpiece, originally presented in English and produced in the United States of America.

title = The Hustler 
overview = Fast Eddie Felson is a small-time pool hustler with a lot of talent but a self-destructive attitude. His bravado causes him to challenge the legendary Minnesota Fats to a high-stakes match. 
Director = Robert Rossen 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 2.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.6 
revenue = 7.6 millions of dollars 
tagline = They called him Fast Eddie. He was a winner. He was a loser. He was a hustler. 
duration of the movie = 2h14 

TP  -  TruePositive
['i would say: correct.the description does mention the director as robert rossen.']
fact : Director = Robert Rossen 

In the American classic "The Hustler," directed by Robert Rossen, we follow the journey of Fast Eddie Felson, a talented yet self-destructive pool hustler. With a bravado that knows no bounds, Fast Eddie challenges the legendary Minnesota Fats to a high-stakes match that will test his skills and his character. Set in the world of underground pool halls, this English-language film showcases the highs and lows of Fast Eddie's hustling lifestyle. With a budget of 2.0 million dollars, the movie captivates audiences with its gripping storyline and stellar performances. As the tension rises, viewers are taken on a 2-hour and 14-minute ride through the competitive and cutthroat world of professional pool. The tagline "They called him Fast Eddie. He was a winner. He was a loser. He was a hustler." perfectly encapsulates the complex character at the heart of this film. With an average rating of 7.6 and a revenue of 7.6 million dollars, "The Hustler" is a timeless classic that continues to resonate with audiences worldwide. The production country of the movie is the United States of America.

With a budget of 2.0 million dollars, the movie captivates audiences with its gripping storyline and stellar performances. As the tension rises, viewers are taken on a 2-hour and 14-minute ride through the competitive and cutthroat world of professional pool. The tagline "They called him Fast Eddie. He was a winner. He was a loser. He was a hustler." perfectly encapsulates the complex character at the heart of this film. With an average rating of 7.6 and a revenue of 7.6 million dollars, "The Hustler" is a timeless classic that continues to resonate with audiences worldwide. The production country of the movie is the United States of America.

title = Shall We Dance? 
overview = Upon first sight of a beautiful instructor, a bored and overworked estate lawyer signs up for ballroom dancing lessons. As he immerses himself in the world of dance, he discovers a newfound passion and zest for life. 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = Step out of the ordinary 

In the heartwarming film "Shall We Dance?", set in the United States of America, a bored and overworked estate lawyer finds himself captivated by a beautiful dance instructor. Intrigued by the idea of stepping out of the ordinary, he decides to sign up for ballroom dancing lessons. As he immerses himself in the world of dance, he discovers a newfound passion and zest for life. Will he find more than just dance lessons in this enchanting journey of self-discovery? Step into the rhythm of "Shall We Dance?" and let the music guide you towards unexpected joy and fulfillment.

With an average rating of 6.9, "Disconnect" is a thought-provoking exploration of the complexities of modern communication and the profound consequences of our interconnected lives.

title = Without a Paddle 
overview = Three friends, whose lives have been drifting apart, reunite for the funeral of a fourth childhood friend. When looking through their childhood belongings, they discover a trunk which contained details on a quest their friend was attempting. It revealed that he was hot on the trail of the $200,000 that went missing with airplane hijacker D.B. Cooper in 1971. They decide to continue his journey, but do not understand the dangers they will soon encounter. 
revenue = 69.6 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Donald De Line 
date of release = the 20 of August 2004 
average note = 5.3 
cast = Seth Green, Matthew Lillard, Dax Shepard, Antony Starr 
tagline = The call of the wild, the thrill of adventure. The mistake of a lifetime. 
budget = 19.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
Director = Steven Brill 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact that "revenue = 69.6 millions of dollars".answer: correct']
fact : revenue = 69.6 millions of dollars 

In "Without a Paddle," directed by Steven Brill and produced by Donald De Line, three childhood friends reunite for the funeral of a fourth friend and discover a trunk containing details of a quest he was on to find the missing $200,000 from airplane hijacker D.B. Cooper in 1971. Seth Green, Matthew Lillard, Dax Shepard, and Antony Starr star in this adventure comedy set in the United States of America. As they embark on this journey, they underestimate the dangers ahead, leading to a series of wild and thrilling encounters. With a tagline that promises "The call of the wild, the thrill of adventure. The mistake of a lifetime," this movie was released on the 20th of August 2004 and grossed $69.6 million at the box office. The film, with an average rating of 5.3, is in English, has a runtime of 1 hour and 35 minutes, and had a budget of $19.0 million.

title = L.A. Zombie 
overview = the film follows an alien zombie creature as he emerges from the sea and attempts to make sense of his new home, Los Angeles. After getting picked up by a surfer in a truck, a severe accident occurs that results in the surfer lying dead in the middle of the road. The alien zombie has sex with the dead man and brings him back to life. Wandering away from the accident, he finds himself among LA’s homeless population where it becomes increasingly unclear whether he really is an alien zombie or a schizophrenic suffering from delusions. Like a kind of dark savior, the alien zombie proceeds to find various dead men in the Greater Los Angeles area and bring them back to life. 
duration of the movie = 1h43 
production compagnie = Wurstfilm 
Producer = Jürgen Brüning 
date of release = the 7 of October 2010 
production countrie = Germany 
revenue = 268.3 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = François Sagat, Rocco Giovanni, Tony Ward, Matthew Rush 
tagline = He CAME to **** the DEAD back to LIFE 
Director = Bruce LaBruce 
budget = 17.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description mentions that the movie\'s runtime is "1 hour and 43 minutes". therefore, my answer is:correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h43 

In "L.A. Zombie," a unique and provocative film directed by Bruce LaBruce, an alien zombie creature emerges from the sea and finds himself in the bustling city of Los Angeles. As he navigates his new surroundings, he encounters a surfer who tragically meets his demise in a fatal accident. In a bizarre turn of events, the alien zombie engages in a shocking act with the dead man, ultimately bringing him back to life. 

The movie delves into the blurred lines between reality and delusion as the alien zombie interacts with LA's homeless population, blurring the lines between his identity as an otherworldly being or a mentally ill individual. In a twisted twist of fate, the alien zombie takes on the role of a dark savior, reviving various deceased men across Greater Los Angeles.

Starring François Sagat, Rocco Giovanni, Tony Ward, and Matthew Rush, "L.A. Zombie" pushes boundaries and challenges perceptions with its dark and thought-provoking narrative. With a runtime of 1 hour and 43 minutes, the film was released on October 7, 2010, by Wurstfilm, a production company based in Germany. Despite its controversial themes, the movie garnered significant attention and amassed a revenue of 268.3 million dollars, surpassing its budget of 17.2 million dollars. The original language of the movie is English, and its tagline, "He CAME to **** the DEAD back to LIFE," encapsulates the eerie and unsettling tone of this unconventional cinematic experience.

With a runtime of 1 hour and 43 minutes, the film was released on October 7, 2010, by Wurstfilm, a production company based in Germany. Despite its controversial themes, the movie garnered significant attention and amassed a revenue of 268.3 million dollars, surpassing its budget of 17.2 million dollars. The original language of the movie is English, and its tagline, "He CAME to **** the DEAD back to LIFE," encapsulates the eerie and unsettling tone of this unconventional cinematic experience. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact you provided is: [cast = françois sagat, rocco giovanni, tony ward, matthew rush]the description mentions: "starring françois sagat, rocco giovanni, tony ward, and matthew rush"so, i would say: correct.']
fact : cast = François Sagat, Rocco Giovanni, Tony Ward, Matthew Rush 

In "L.A. Zombie," a unique and provocative film directed by Bruce LaBruce, an alien zombie creature emerges from the sea and finds himself in the bustling city of Los Angeles. As he navigates his new surroundings, he encounters a surfer who tragically meets his demise in a fatal accident. In a bizarre turn of events, the alien zombie engages in a shocking act with the dead man, ultimately bringing him back to life. 

The movie delves into the blurred lines between reality and delusion as the alien zombie interacts with LA's homeless population, blurring the lines between his identity as an otherworldly being or a mentally ill individual. In a twisted twist of fate, the alien zombie takes on the role of a dark savior, reviving various deceased men across Greater Los Angeles.

Starring François Sagat, Rocco Giovanni, Tony Ward, and Matthew Rush, "L.A. Zombie" pushes boundaries and challenges perceptions with its dark and thought-provoking narrative. title = Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid 
overview = In late 1890s Wyoming, Butch Cassidy is the affable, clever and talkative leader of the outlaw Hole in the Wall Gang. His closest companion is the laconic dead-shot 'Sundance Kid'. As the west rapidly becomes civilized, the law finally catches up to Butch, Sundance and their gang.  Chased doggedly by a special posse, the two decide to make their way to South America in hopes of evading their pursuers once and for all. 
Director = George Roy Hill 
cast = Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Katharine Ross, Strother Martin 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 23 of September 1969 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the description indeed talks about george roy hill being the director of "butch cassidy and the sundance kid".']
fact : Director = George Roy Hill 

In the classic Western film "Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid," directed by George Roy Hill, viewers are transported to late 1890s Wyoming. The affable and clever Butch Cassidy, portrayed by Paul Newman, leads the outlaw Hole in the Wall Gang alongside his laconic companion, the dead-shot Sundance Kid, played by Robert Redford. As the Wild West transitions into a more civilized era, the law begins to close in on Butch, Sundance, and their gang. With a special posse hot on their trail, the duo makes a daring decision to flee to South America in a last-ditch effort to escape capture. Joined by Katharine Ross and Strother Martin in the cast, this iconic American film was released on September 23, 1969, captivating audiences with its thrilling tale of friendship, outlaws, and the pursuit of freedom. The production country of the film is the United States of America. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive

fact : cast = Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Katharine Ross, Strother Martin 

In the classic Western film "Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid," directed by George Roy Hill, viewers are transported to late 1890s Wyoming. The affable and clever Butch Cassidy, portrayed by Paul Newman, leads the outlaw Hole in the Wall Gang alongside his laconic companion, the dead-shot Sundance Kid, played by Robert Redford. As the Wild West transitions into a more civilized era, the law begins to close in on Butch, Sundance, and their gang. With a special posse hot on their trail, the duo makes a daring decision to flee to South America in a last-ditch effort to escape capture. Joined by Katharine Ross and Strother Martin in the cast, this iconic American film was released on September 23, 1969, captivating audiences with its thrilling tale of friendship, outlaws, and the pursuit of freedom. title = Fateful Findings 
overview = A small boy discovers a mystical power as a child. He is then separated from his childhood girlfriend. He grows up to be a computer scientist who is hacking into the most secret national and international secrets, as well as being an acclaimed novel writer. His childhood 'finding' gives him amazing paranormal powers. He is reunited with the childhood girlfriend, mystically, on his hospital deathbed... as his relationship with his current drug addict girlfriend is deteriorating. The passions build between the threesome. Mystical, psychiatric and worldly forces rise to prevent him from revealing the hacked secrets. He attempts to reveal all in a Washington DC large press conference, with 'fateful' and dangerous consequences. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['the description does not mention neil breen or any production company by that name. therefore, my answer is:wrong']
fact : production compagnie = Neil Breen 

In the movie "Fateful Findings," a young boy stumbles upon a mystical power that shapes his destiny. As he grows up to become a computer scientist and a successful novelist, he delves into hacking the world's most confidential information. Along the way, he is reunited with his childhood sweetheart under mysterious circumstances, while his relationship with his current drug-addicted girlfriend crumbles. As he grapples with his newfound paranormal abilities, he faces opposition from both supernatural and real-world forces determined to keep his secrets hidden. Ultimately, he risks everything to expose the truth at a high-stakes press conference in Washington DC, leading to fateful and perilous outcomes.

title = A Funny Man 
overview = Opening in the seductive style of the sixties, »A Funny Man« uncovers the perennial loneliness that comedian Dirch Passer (Nikolaj Lie Kaas) has found himself in after a fast-tracked rise to fame. He struggles between his own desire to gain critical respect and servicing the audience¿s needs. Costing his kindred friendship to on-stage partner Kjeld Petersen (Lars Ranthe) Dirch takes on Steinbeck's classic »Of Mice and Men«, only for the audience to break out in laughter at his first line. Dirch's Lennie becomes a running joke, and so has, Dirch believes, his own life. 
Director = Martin Zandvliet 
cast = Nikolaj Lie Kaas, Julie Zangenberg, Lars Ranthe, Lars Brygmann 
tagline = A biography of the Danish actor and comedian, Dirch Passer 
revenue = 243.4 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.9 
Producer = Mikael Chr. Rieks 
production compagnie = Koncern TV- og Filmproduktion 
original language of the movie = Danish 
duration of the movie = 1h56 
budget = 269.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Denmark 
date of release = the 25 of August 2011 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact you provided is: [director = martin zandvliet]the description says: "in \'a funny man,\' directed by martin zandvliet...". so, the answer is: correct']
fact : Director = Martin Zandvliet 

In "A Funny Man," directed by Martin Zandvliet and produced by Mikael Chr. Rieks, audiences are taken on a journey through the glamorous yet lonely life of Danish comedian Dirch Passer, portrayed by Nikolaj Lie Kaas. As Passer grapples with the pressures of fame and the desire for critical acclaim, his friendship with on-stage partner Kjeld Petersen, played by Lars Ranthe, is put to the test. The film delves into Passer's attempt to bring Steinbeck's "Of Mice and Men" to the stage, only to be met with unexpected laughter from the audience. This moment marks a turning point for Passer, as he navigates the fine line between comedy and tragedy in his own life. With a stellar cast including Julie Zangenberg and Lars Brygmann, "A Funny Man" is a poignant biography that explores the highs and lows of a comedic legend. Released on August 25, 2011, in its original Danish language, the film garnered a revenue of 243.4 million dollars, despite its budget of 269.3 million dollars. With an average rating of 6.9, this production from Koncern TV- og Filmproduktion is a must-watch for fans of biographical dramas. The movie was produced in Denmark.

title = Inventing the Abbotts 
overview = In the 1950s, brothers Jacey and Doug Holt, who come from the poorer side of their sleepy Midwestern town, vie for the affections of the wealthy, lovely Abbott sisters. Lady-killer Jacey alternates between Eleanor and Alice, wanting simply to break the hearts of rich young women. But sensitive Doug has a real romance with Pamela, which Jacey and the Abbott patriarch, Lloyd, both frown upon. 
production compagnie = Fox 2000 Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description mentions: "produced by fox 2000 pictures", so:* fact: the production company is indeed fox 2000 pictures.* answer: correct!']
fact : production compagnie = Fox 2000 Pictures 

In "Inventing the Abbotts," set in the 1950s in a sleepy Midwestern town, the rivalry between brothers Jacey and Doug Holt takes center stage as they both pursue the wealthy and beautiful Abbott sisters. Lady-killer Jacey alternates between Eleanor and Alice, wanting simply to break the hearts of rich young women. But sensitive Doug has a real romance with Pamela, which Jacey and the Abbott patriarch, Lloyd, both frown upon. Produced by Fox 2000 Pictures, this tale of love, class divide, and family secrets unfolds against the backdrop of a bygone era.

In the English-language film "Time Chasers," inventor Matthew Bruch creates a groundbreaking time machine. However, his invention falls into the hands of an evil CEO, leading to a thrilling race against time to prevent its misuse. With a stellar cast including Matthew Bruch, Bonnie Pritchard, Peter Harrington, and George Woodard, director David Giancola crafts a captivating tale set in the United States of America. As the tagline suggests, "Saving the future before time runs out..." is the ultimate mission in this sci-fi adventure.

However, his invention falls into the hands of an evil CEO, leading to a thrilling race against time to prevent its misuse. As the tagline suggests, "Saving the future before time runs out..." is the ultimate mission in this sci-fi adventure.

title = True Grit 
overview = Following the murder of her father by hired hand Tom Chaney, 14-year-old farm girl Mattie Ross sets out to capture the killer. To aid her, she hires the toughest U.S. Marshal she can find, a man with "true grit," Reuben J. "Rooster" Cogburn. Mattie insists on accompanying Cogburn, whose drinking, sloth, and generally reprobate character do not augment her faith in him. Against his wishes, she joins him in his trek into the Indian Nations in search of Chaney. They are joined by Texas Ranger LaBoeuf, who wants Chaney for his own purposes. The unlikely trio find danger and adventure on the journey, and each has his or her "grit" tested. 
Director = Joel Coen 
cast = Jeff Bridges, Matt Damon, Josh Brolin, Barry Pepper 
average note = 7.2 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact that the director = joel coen.so, the answer is: correct']
fact : Director = Joel Coen 

In the gripping Western film "True Grit," directed by Joel Coen, 14-year-old Mattie Ross seeks justice for her father's murder at the hands of Tom Chaney. With unwavering determination, she enlists the help of the rugged U.S. Marshal Rooster Cogburn, known for his "true grit." Reluctantly accompanied by Mattie, Cogburn sets out on a perilous journey into the Indian Nations to track down Chaney, joined by the determined Texas Ranger LaBoeuf. As they face danger and adversity along the way, each member of this unlikely trio has their resilience and courage put to the test. Starring Jeff Bridges, Matt Damon, Josh Brolin, and Barry Pepper, "True Grit" is a tale of vengeance, bravery, and the enduring power of grit. (Average note: 7.2)

title = The State of Things 
overview = On location in Portugal, a film crew runs out of film while making their own version of Roger Corman's The Day the World Ended (1956) . The producer is nowhere to be found and director Munro attempts to find him in hopes of being able to finish the film. 
date of release = the 22 of March 1982 
budget = 174.4 millions of dollars 
revenue = 102.3 millions of dollars 
Producer = Chris Sievernich 
production compagnie = Pro-ject Filmproduktion 
original language of the movie = German 
Director = Wim Wenders 
cast = Isabelle Weingarten, Rebecca Pauly, Jeffrey Kime, Geoffrey Carey 
average note = 6.2 
duration of the movie = 2h05 
tagline = They didn't want to kill him. They just wanted a story. 
production countrie = Germany 

!!! BAD OUTPUT !!!
['i found the fact!']
fact : date of release = the 22 of March 1982 

In 1982, director Wim Wenders takes audiences on a behind-the-scenes journey with "The State of Things." Filming in Portugal, a movie crew faces a crisis when they run out of film while shooting their own rendition of a classic sci-fi film. As producer Chris Sievernich goes missing, director Munro, portrayed by Jeffrey Kime, embarks on a quest to locate him and salvage the project. With a budget of 174.4 million dollars, the film managed to gross 102.3 million dollars at the box office. The movie, presented in its original German language, features a talented cast including Isabelle Weingarten, Rebecca Pauly, and Geoffrey Carey. The average rating of 6.2 reflects the captivating 2-hour and 5-minute runtime of this German production by Pro-ject Filmproduktion. The tagline "They didn't want to kill him. They just wanted a story" sets the tone for this intriguing tale of filmmaking challenges and unexpected twists. "The State of Things" was released on the 22nd of March 1982 in Germany.

In 1982, director Wim Wenders takes audiences on a behind-the-scenes journey with "The State of Things." Filming in Portugal, a movie crew faces a crisis when they run out of film while shooting their own rendition of a classic sci-fi film. As producer Chris Sievernich goes missing, director Munro, portrayed by Jeffrey Kime, embarks on a quest to locate him and salvage the project. With a budget of 174.4 million dollars, the film managed to gross 102.3 million dollars at the box office. The movie, presented in its original German language, features a talented cast including Isabelle Weingarten, Rebecca Pauly, and Geoffrey Carey. The average rating of 6.2 reflects the captivating 2-hour and 5-minute runtime of this German production by Pro-ject Filmproduktion. The tagline "They didn't want to kill him. They just wanted a story" sets the tone for this intriguing tale of filmmaking challenges and unexpected twists. "The State of Things" was released on the 22nd of March 1982 in Germany.

['the description doesn\'t talk about the fact "ted is coming, again."']
fact : tagline = Ted is Coming, Again. 

In "Ted 2", the lovable teddy bear Ted and his wife Tami-Lynn embark on a hilarious journey to start a family. However, their plans hit a roadblock when Ted must legally prove his personhood in court to qualify as a parent. With a stellar cast including Mark Wahlberg, Seth MacFarlane, Amanda Seyfried, and Jessica Barth, this comedy sequel is filled with laughs and heartwarming moments. Produced by Universal Pictures and helmed by producer Scott Stuber, "Ted 2" grossed a whopping $217 million at the box office, surpassing its $68 million budget. The tagline "Ted is Coming, Again" perfectly captures the anticipation and excitement surrounding this uproarious film. With an average rating of 6.2, this English-language production from the United States is a must-watch for fans of irreverent humor and unforgettable characters.

title = WolfCop 
overview = It's not unusual for alcoholic cop Lou to black out and wake up in unfamiliar surroundings, but lately things have taken a turn for the strange...and hairy. WolfCop is the story of one cop's quest to become a better man. One transformation at a time. 
cast = Leo Fafard, Amy Matysio, Jonathan Cherry, Sarah Lind 
date of release = the 6 of June 2014 
production countrie = Canada 
production compagnie = Echolands Creative Group 
Producer = Lowell Dean 
average note = 5.2 

TP  -  TruePositive
['according to the description, the fact is:correct: the description mentions that the movie "wolfcop" stars [cast = leo fafard, amy matysio, jonathan cherry, sarah lind] as the cast.']
fact : cast = Leo Fafard, Amy Matysio, Jonathan Cherry, Sarah Lind 

In the Canadian production "WolfCop," released on the 6th of June 2014, viewers are taken on a wild ride alongside alcoholic cop Lou, portrayed by Leo Fafard. Lou's life takes a bizarre turn as he discovers his newfound ability to transform into a werewolf. With the help of his colleagues, including Amy Matysio, Jonathan Cherry, and Sarah Lind, Lou embarks on a journey of self-improvement, one hairy transformation at a time. Produced by Lowell Dean under the Echolands Creative Group, this film blends elements of horror, comedy, and action, earning an average rating of 5.2. Get ready for a howling good time with "WolfCop."

fact : Producer = Celine Schultz 

In "Beat," a compelling biographical drama, viewers are immersed in the tumultuous life of writer William Seward Burroughs and his wife. Produced by Celine Schultz and directed by Gary Walkow, this film delves into the complexities of their relationship against the backdrop of a changing society. Set in English and brought to life by Martien Holdings A.V.V., the movie explores the tagline "Sex and Drugs before Rock and Roll." With a staggering revenue of 292.3 million dollars, "Beat" captivates audiences with its raw portrayal of love, addiction, and artistic expression.

Set in English and brought to life by Martien Holdings A.V.V., the movie explores the tagline "Sex and Drugs before Rock and Roll." With a staggering revenue of 292.3 million dollars, "Beat" captivates audiences with its raw portrayal of love, addiction, and artistic expression.

title = The Autopsy of Jane Doe 
overview = Father and son coroners receive a mysterious unidentified corpse with no apparent cause of death. As they attempt to examine the beautiful young "Jane Doe," they discover increasingly bizarre clues that hold the key to her terrifying secrets. 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 21 of December 2016 
budget = 194.8 millions of dollars 
Producer = Eric Garcia 
cast = Emile Hirsch, Brian Cox, Ophelia Lovibond, Olwen Catherine Kelly 
average note = 6.3 
tagline = Every body has a secret. 
production compagnie = IM Global 
Director = André Øvredal 

TP  -  TruePositive
['according to your instructions, i will identify whether the given fact is mentioned in the description or not.the fact: [original language of the movie = english ]i can see that the description mentions: "the original language of the movie is english."so, my answer would be: correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "The Autopsy of Jane Doe," directed by André Øvredal and released on the 21st of December 2016, father and son coroners, played by Emile Hirsch and Brian Cox, are faced with a perplexing case. When they receive the body of the mysterious "Jane Doe" with no clear cause of death, they embark on a chilling examination that unravels a series of eerie and unsettling clues. As they delve deeper into Jane Doe's secrets, they unearth a terrifying truth that challenges everything they thought they knew. With a budget of 194.8 million dollars, producer Eric Garcia brings this haunting tale to life under the production company IM Global. Alongside Ophelia Lovibond and Olwen Catherine Kelly in the cast, the film maintains an average note of 6.3. The tagline "Every body has a secret" sets the tone for this suspenseful and enigmatic thriller, where the truth lies within the chilling depths of the autopsy room. The original language of the movie is English.

overview = When Dr. Indiana Jones – the tweed-suited professor who just happens to be a celebrated archaeologist – is hired by the government to locate the legendary Ark of the Covenant, he finds himself up against the entire Nazi regime. 
budget = 18.0 millions of dollars

average note = 7.7 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 389.9 millions of dollars 
tagline = Indiana Jones - the new hero from the creators of JAWS and STAR WARS. 
production compagnie = Lucasfilm

duration of the movie = 1h55 
Producer = Frank Marshall 
date of release = the 12 of June 1981 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description mentions that the budget for "raiders of the lost ark" was "[budget = 18.0 millions of dollars]" which matches the fact given.so, my answer is: correct.']
fact : budget = 18.0 millions of dollars 

In the action-packed adventure film "Raiders of the Lost Ark," directed by Steven Spielberg and produced by Frank Marshall, renowned archaeologist Dr. Indiana Jones, portrayed by Harrison Ford, is on a mission to locate the legendary Ark of the Covenant. With a budget of 18.0 million dollars, the movie takes viewers on a thrilling journey as Indiana Jones faces off against the entire Nazi regime in his quest. Joined by a cast including Karen Allen, Paul Freeman, and Ronald Lacey, the film, released on the 12th of June 1981 in the United States of America, captivates audiences with its blend of history, action, and suspense. With a tagline that promises Indiana Jones as the new hero from the creators of JAWS and STAR WARS, the movie grossed a whopping 389.9 million dollars at the box office. At an average rating of 7.7, this 1 hour and 55-minute film in English by Lucasfilm is a timeless classic that continues to enthrall audiences worldwide.

title = Bubble Boy 
overview = Jimmy is young man who was born without an immune system and has lived his life within a plastic bubble in his bedroom... who pines for the sweet caresses of girl-next-door Chloe. But when Chloe decides to marry her high school boyfriend, Jimmy -- bubble suit and all -- treks cross-country to stop her. Swoosie Kurtz, as Jimmy's overprotective mom, co-stars along with Fabio, who portrays the leader of a religious cult. 
date of release = the 24 of August 2001 
budget = 108.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Jake Gyllenhaal, Swoosie Kurtz, Marley Shelton, Danny Trejo 
duration of the movie = 1h24 
tagline = Life is an adventure. Don't blow it. 
revenue = 23.8 millions of dollars 
Producer = Beau Flynn 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact.answer: correct']
fact : date of release = the 24 of August 2001 

In the heartwarming comedy "Bubble Boy," released on the 24th of August 2001, we meet Jimmy, a young man who has spent his entire life confined within a plastic bubble due to being born without an immune system. Portrayed by Jake Gyllenhaal, Jimmy's world revolves around his longing for the girl-next-door, Chloe, played by Marley Shelton. When Chloe announces her upcoming marriage to her high school sweetheart, Jimmy, with the support of his overprotective mom (Swoosie Kurtz), embarks on a daring cross-country journey in his bubble suit to win her heart. Along the way, he encounters eccentric characters, including the leader of a religious cult played by none other than Fabio. As the tagline suggests, "Life is an adventure. Don't blow it." Despite a budget of 108.0 million dollars, the movie grossed 23.8 million dollars at the box office. Produced by Beau Flynn, this 1 hour and 24-minute film is a quirky and heartwarming tale of love, determination, and breaking free from limitations. The cast includes Jake Gyllenhaal, Swoosie Kurtz, Marley Shelton, and Danny Trejo.

title = InSight 
overview = Kaitlyn, an ER nurse who is tending to a young stabbing victim, is accidentally electrocuted by the defibrillator that is used in an effort to save the woman's life. Almost immediately Kaitlyn starts to experience the victim's memories. She turns to family, friends, and the police, but no one takes her seriously. She decides that she must take it upon herself to try to solve the crime - or risk the terrifying visions ending in her own sanity being at stake. Ultimately Kaitlyn teams up with the detective on the case and weaves her way through the victim's past - to discover not only the brutal truth, but also some very unexpected lessons about life, love, sorrow and forgiveness along the way. (official website) 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = John Constantine   
Director = Richard Gabai 
duration of the movie = 1h32 
average note = 5.2 
budget = 125.4 millions of dollars 
cast = Max Perlich, Lesley-Ann Brandt, Matt Knudsen, Rick Overton 
tagline = Fear what you see 
production compagnie =  Braeburn Entertainment 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 0.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 2 of September 2011 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact you mentioned is: [original language of the movie = english]the description states: "this english-language film...", which means that the original language of the movie indeed equals english.so, i would answer: correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the gripping thriller "InSight", directed by Richard Gabai and produced by John Constantine, we follow the story of Kaitlyn, an ER nurse who gains the ability to experience the memories of a stabbing victim after being accidentally electrocuted. Despite her best efforts to seek help from those around her, including the police, Kaitlyn is met with skepticism. Determined to solve the crime and save her own sanity, she teams up with a detective, portrayed by Max Perlich, and delves into the victim's past. As she unravels the brutal truth, Kaitlyn also learns unexpected lessons about life, love, sorrow, and forgiveness. With a runtime of 1 hour and 32 minutes, this English-language film, released on September 2, 2011, under the tagline "Fear what you see", offers a suspenseful journey filled with twists and turns. Despite its budget of 125.4 million dollars, the movie did not generate revenue at the box office, leaving viewers with a haunting and thought-provoking experience.

The movie features a cast including Max Perlich, Lesley-Ann Brandt, Matt Knudsen, and Rick Overton. The production company behind "InSight" is Braeburn Entertainment, and it was filmed in the United States of America. The average note for the movie is 5.2.

As she unravels the brutal truth, Kaitlyn also learns unexpected lessons about life, love, sorrow, and forgiveness. With a runtime of 1 hour and 32 minutes, this English-language film, released on September 2, 2011, under the tagline "Fear what you see", offers a suspenseful journey filled with twists and turns. Despite its budget of 125.4 million dollars, the movie did not generate revenue at the box office, leaving viewers with a haunting and thought-provoking experience.

The movie features a cast including Max Perlich, Lesley-Ann Brandt, Matt Knudsen, and Rick Overton. The production company behind "InSight" is Braeburn Entertainment, and it was filmed in the United States of America. The average note for the movie is 5.2.

['the description talks about the fact that the movie was released on september 2, 2011. therefore:* correct: the movie "insight" was released on september 2, 2011.']
fact : date of release = the 2 of September 2011 

In the gripping thriller "InSight", directed by Richard Gabai and produced by John Constantine, we follow the story of Kaitlyn, an ER nurse who gains the ability to experience the memories of a stabbing victim after being accidentally electrocuted. Despite her best efforts to seek help from those around her, including the police, Kaitlyn is met with skepticism. Determined to solve the crime and save her own sanity, she teams up with a detective, portrayed by Max Perlich, and delves into the victim's past. As she unravels the brutal truth, Kaitlyn also learns unexpected lessons about life, love, sorrow, and forgiveness. With a runtime of 1 hour and 32 minutes, this English-language film, released on September 2, 2011, under the tagline "Fear what you see", offers a suspenseful journey filled with twists and turns. Despite its budget of 125.4 million dollars, the movie did not generate revenue at the box office, leaving viewers with a haunting and thought-provoking experience.

['the description does mention the fact about the duration of the movie. it states: "with a runtime of 1 hour and 28 minutes...". therefore, my answer is: correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h28 

In "Deadly Daycare," Rachel makes the difficult decision to enroll her three-year-old daughter in daycare. Initially relieved to have found a safe place for her child, Rachel soon becomes suspicious of the teacher's increasingly intense bond with her daughter, bordering on obsession. As the tension escalates, Rachel must fight to protect her family from the dangerous consequences of this twisted relationship. With a runtime of 1 hour and 28 minutes, this gripping thriller from Feifer Worldwide explores the dark side of motherly love and the lengths one woman will go to in order to keep her child safe. Released on October 24, 2014, "Deadly Daycare" grossed an impressive $141.9 million at the box office, despite its modest budget of $135.5 million. The tagline "Motherly love knows no bounds" perfectly encapsulates the chilling tale of love, betrayal, and survival that unfolds in this heart-pounding film. The average rating for the movie is 3.0.

title = Limitless 
overview = A paranoia-fueled action thriller about an unsuccessful writer whose life is transformed by a top-secret "smart drug" that allows him to use 100% of his brain and become a perfect version of himself. His enhanced abilities soon attract shadowy forces that threaten his new life in this darkly comic and provocative film. 
cast = Bradley Cooper, Robert De Niro, Abbie Cornish, Andrew Howard 
budget = 27.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = What if a pill could make you rich and powerful?

fact : cast = Bradley Cooper, Robert De Niro, Abbie Cornish, Andrew Howard 

In the thrilling action-packed movie "Limitless," an unsuccessful writer's life takes a dramatic turn when he discovers a top-secret "smart drug" that unlocks his brain's full potential, allowing him to become the perfect version of himself. As he harnesses 100% of his cognitive abilities, he attracts the attention of mysterious forces that jeopardize his newfound success. Starring Bradley Cooper, Robert De Niro, Abbie Cornish, and Andrew Howard, this darkly comic and provocative film explores the consequences of unlimited power and intelligence. Set in the United States of America and with a budget of 27.0 million dollars, "Limitless" poses the intriguing question: What if a pill could make you rich and powerful?

In the thrilling movie "Gray Lady Down," directed by David Greene, the USS Neptune, a nuclear submarine, faces a catastrophic event when it is sunk off the coast of Connecticut following a collision with a Norwegian cargo ship. As the navy races against time to rescue the trapped crew, tensions rise in this high-stakes mission. With a tagline that emphasizes the urgency of the situation - "Trapped underwater... with time running out" - this American production released on the 10th of March 1978 keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. Despite its intense storyline and average note of 6.7, the film grossed 5.4 million dollars in revenue, proving to be a compelling and financially successful cinematic experience. The production country of "Gray Lady Down" is the United States of America.

title = The Woman in Green 
overview = A series of bizarre, seemingly unconnected murders leads Holmes and Watson to a society of hypnotists and a mysterious, glamorous woman. The case takes a mesmerizing turn when the fiendish Dr. Moriarty appears to be involved. Reason? He was seen most recently swinging from the hangman's noose. 
budget = 85.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 287.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
duration of the movie = 1h08 
tagline = Temptress of Pleasure - or Mistress of Murder? 
date of release = the 27 of July 1945 
Producer = Roy William Neill 

TP  -  TruePositive
['according to the description, the fact "[budget = 85.3 millions of dollars]" is:**correct**the description states: "with a budget of 85.3 million dollars, this mesmerizing tale unfolds..." which matches the given fact.']
fact : budget = 85.3 millions of dollars 

In the captivating mystery thriller "The Woman in Green," Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson find themselves entangled in a web of perplexing murders that lead them to a secretive society of hypnotists and a seductive, enigmatic woman. As they delve deeper into the case, the notorious Dr. Moriarty emerges as a potential suspect, despite the shocking revelation that he was recently witnessed facing the hangman's noose. With a budget of 85.3 million dollars, this mesmerizing tale unfolds in the United States of America, under the skilled production of Universal Pictures and producer Roy William Neill. The film, with a runtime of 1 hour and 8 minutes, was released on July 27, 1945, captivating audiences with its tagline: "Temptress of Pleasure - or Mistress of Murder?" With a remarkable revenue of 287.0 million dollars, "The Woman in Green" is a classic thriller that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats.

title = Wendy and Lucy 
overview = Wendy, a near-penniless drifter, is traveling to Alaska in search of work, and her only companion is her dog, Lucy. Already perilously close to losing everything, Wendy hits a bigger bump in the road when her old car breaks down and she is arrested for shoplifting dog food. When she posts bail and returns to retrieve Lucy, she finds that the dog is gone, prompting a frantic search for her pet. 
Producer = Neil Kopp 
revenue = 58.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 6.4 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 22 of May 2008 
duration of the movie = 1h20 
production compagnie = Glass Eye Pix 
Director = Kelly Reichardt 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact that the producer is neil kopp. therefore, my answer is: correct.']
fact : Producer = Neil Kopp 

In "Wendy and Lucy," a poignant drama directed by Kelly Reichardt and produced by Neil Kopp, we follow Wendy, a struggling drifter on a journey to Alaska with her loyal companion, a dog named Lucy. When Wendy's car breaks down and she is arrested for shoplifting dog food, her already precarious situation becomes even more dire. After posting bail, Wendy frantically searches for Lucy, only to discover that her beloved pet is missing. As she navigates through the challenges of her nomadic lifestyle, Wendy's emotional journey is beautifully portrayed against the backdrop of the United States of America. The film was released on the 22nd of May 2008, has a duration of 1 hour and 20 minutes, and is in English, the original language of the movie. With a revenue of 58.3 million dollars and an average rating of 6.4, "Wendy and Lucy" captivates audiences with its raw portrayal of love, loss, and the unbreakable bond between a woman and her dog. The production company behind the film is Glass Eye Pix. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact "revenue = 58.3 millions of dollars". therefore, i would say:answer: correct']
fact : revenue = 58.3 millions of dollars 

In "Wendy and Lucy," a poignant drama directed by Kelly Reichardt and produced by Neil Kopp, we follow Wendy, a struggling drifter on a journey to Alaska with her loyal companion, a dog named Lucy. When Wendy's car breaks down and she is arrested for shoplifting dog food, her already precarious situation becomes even more dire. After posting bail, Wendy frantically searches for Lucy, only to discover that her beloved pet is missing. As she navigates through the challenges of her nomadic lifestyle, Wendy's emotional journey is beautifully portrayed against the backdrop of the United States of America. The film was released on the 22nd of May 2008, has a duration of 1 hour and 20 minutes, and is in English, the original language of the movie. With a revenue of 58.3 million dollars and an average rating of 6.4, "Wendy and Lucy" captivates audiences with its raw portrayal of love, loss, and the unbreakable bond between a woman and her dog. The production company behind the film is Glass Eye Pix. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive

As they delve deeper into the investigation, William must challenge the authority of the Church and confront a shadowy conspiracy within the monastery. With his formidable intelligence as his only weapon, William navigates a treacherous path to solve the crimes. title = It Conquered the World 
overview = An alien from Venus tries to take over the world with the help of a disillusioned human scientist. 
Director = Roger Corman 
revenue = 279.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = Every man its prisoner... every woman its slave! 
date of release = the 14 of July 1956 
average note = 4.0 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 158.3 millions of dollars 
Producer = Roger Corman 
duration of the movie = 1h11 
cast = Peter Graves, Beverly Garland, Lee Van Cleef, Sally Fraser 
production compagnie = Sunset Productions 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact that the director is roger corman. therefore, my answer is: correct.']
fact : Director = Roger Corman 

In the sci-fi classic "It Conquered the World," directed by Roger Corman, an alien from Venus enlists the help of a disillusioned human scientist in a plot to take over the world. With a tagline that ominously declares, "Every man its prisoner... every woman its slave!" the movie was released on the 14th of July 1956. Starring Peter Graves, Beverly Garland, Lee Van Cleef, and Sally Fraser, the film captivated audiences with its English language dialogue. Produced by Roger Corman under Sunset Productions, the movie had a budget of 158.3 million dollars and went on to earn a whopping 279.0 million dollars in revenue. With an average rating of 4.0, this 1 hour and 11-minute long movie remains a cult favorite in the United States of America.

In the classic film "Written on the Wind," a young woman finds herself entangled in the web of a corrupt oil family after marrying into it. As she navigates the complexities of her new life, she unexpectedly falls for her husband's best friend, leading to a series of dramatic events. Starring Rock Hudson, Lauren Bacall, Robert Stack, and Dorothy Malone, this American production takes viewers on a captivating journey through love, betrayal, and power struggles. With an average rating of 6.9, the movie was released on the 1st of December 1956 and grossed an impressive $186.8 million at the box office. At a runtime of 1 hour and 39 minutes, "Written on the Wind" remains a timeless classic that continues to captivate audiences with its gripping storyline and stellar performances. The production country of the film is the United States of America.

Starring Rock Hudson, Lauren Bacall, Robert Stack, and Dorothy Malone, this American production takes viewers on a captivating journey through love, betrayal, and power struggles. With an average rating of 6.9, the movie was released on the 1st of December 1956 and grossed an impressive $186.8 million at the box office. At a runtime of 1 hour and 39 minutes, "Written on the Wind" remains a timeless classic that continues to captivate audiences with its gripping storyline and stellar performances. The production country of the film is the United States of America.

title = The One 
overview = A sheriff's deputy fights an alternate universe version of himself who grows stronger with each alternate self he kills. 
Director = James Wong 
budget = 49.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Charles Newirth 
duration of the movie = 1h27 
tagline = Stealing the power of the universes one by one. 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['according to the description, the fact is:**correct**the director mentioned in the description is indeed james wong, which matches the given fact.']
fact : Director = James Wong 

In "The One," directed by James Wong and produced by Charles Newirth, a sheriff's deputy finds himself in a high-stakes battle against an alternate universe version of himself. As he confronts this formidable foe, he discovers that his doppelganger grows stronger with each alternate self he eliminates. With a budget of 49.0 million dollars, this action-packed thriller from Columbia Pictures unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 27 minutes. The tagline "Stealing the power of the universes one by one" sets the tone for a mind-bending journey through parallel realities where the ultimate showdown awaits.

title = School Ties 
overview = When David Greene receives a football scholarship to a prestigious prep school in the 1950s, he feels pressure to hide the fact that he is Jewish from his classmates and teachers, fearing that they may be anti-Semitic. He quickly becomes the big man on campus thanks to his football skills, but when his Jewish background is discovered, his worst fears are realized and his friends turn on him with violent threats and public ridicule. 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 18 of September 1992 
budget = 181.9 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures

In the 1950s drama "School Ties," David Greene navigates the challenges of concealing his Jewish identity at a prestigious prep school after earning a football scholarship. As he rises to popularity on campus, his secret is exposed, leading to a heartbreaking betrayal by his friends through threats and public humiliation. Released on September 18, 1992, this English-language film produced by Paramount Pictures delves into themes of prejudice and the harsh realities of discrimination. With a budget of 181.9 million dollars, "School Ties" delivers a powerful narrative that resonates with audiences long after the credits roll.

title = Billy's Hollywood Screen Kiss 
overview = Billy, a struggling young gay photographer (who likes Polaroids), tired of being the "other man", falls in love with Gabriel, a waiter and aspiring musician who is probably straight but possibly gay or at least curious. Billy tries to get Gabriel to model for his latest project, a series of remakes of famous Hollywood screen kisses, featuring male couples, while also trying to win his affections. 
Producer = Marcus Hu 
average note = 5.2 
tagline = Lights!... Camera!... Attraction! 
date of release = the 24 of July 1998 
production compagnie = Revolutionary Eye LLC 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does mention that marcus hu is the producer, so i would answer: correct.']
fact : Producer = Marcus Hu 

In "Billy's Hollywood Screen Kiss," a struggling young gay photographer named Billy finds himself infatuated with Gabriel, a waiter and aspiring musician whose sexual orientation remains ambiguous. Determined to win Gabriel's heart, Billy convinces him to model for a series of photographs recreating iconic Hollywood screen kisses with male couples. As their relationship unfolds, Billy navigates the complexities of love and desire in a world where attraction knows no bounds. Produced by Marcus Hu and released on the 24th of July 1998 by Revolutionary Eye LLC, this film captures the essence of romance, art, and self-discovery. With an average rating of 5.2, "Billy's Hollywood Screen Kiss" invites viewers to witness a captivating tale where lights, camera, and attraction intertwine to create a mesmerizing cinematic experience. The tagline for the film is "Lights!... Camera!... Attraction!"

title = Catch That Kid 
overview = Athletic 12-year-old Maddy (Kristen Stewart) shares an enthusiasm for mountain climbing with her father, Tom (Sam Robards). Unfortunately, Tom suffers a spinal injury while scaling Mount Everest, and his family is unable to afford the surgery that can save him. Maddy decides to get the money for her father's operation by robbing a high-security bank. She relies on her climbing skills and help from her geeky friends (Max Thieriot, Corbin Bleu) to pull it off successfully. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['you want me to identify whether the description mentions the fact that the movie "catch that kid" was released on february 6th, 2004.according to the description, there is no mention of the date of release. therefore, i would say:the description doesn\'t talk about the given fact.so, my answer is: wrong']
fact : date of release = the 6 of February 2004 

In the thrilling movie "Catch That Kid," athletic 12-year-old Maddy, portrayed by Kristen Stewart, faces a heartbreaking dilemma when her father, Tom, played by Sam Robards, sustains a spinal injury during a mountain climbing expedition. With the family unable to afford the life-saving surgery, Maddy takes matters into her own hands. Determined to secure the funds for her father's operation, she hatches a daring plan to rob a high-security bank. Utilizing her exceptional climbing abilities and enlisting the help of her geeky friends, portrayed by Max Thieriot and Corbin Bleu, Maddy embarks on a risky mission that will test her courage and skills to the limit. Will Maddy and her friends succeed in their audacious heist and save her father's life?

Facts included in the description:
1. Title: Catch That Kid
2. Protagonist: Maddy, portrayed by Kristen Stewart
3. Father's Name: Tom, played by Sam Robards
4. Father's Injury: Spinal injury while scaling Mount Everest
5. Motive: Family unable to afford surgery for Tom
6. Plan: Robbing a high-security bank
7. Allies: Geeky friends, portrayed by Max Thieriot and Corbin Bleu

title = Dr. Cabbie 
overview = An unemployed doctor turned cab driver becomes a local hero when he converts his taxi into a mobile clinic. Dr. CABBIE is the heart warming journey of a young Indian Doctor who immigrates to Canada with the selfless ambition of healing others while beginning a new life in the land of opportunity. Dr. CABBIE discovers his true purpose and true love when he embarks upon this journey of a doctor turned cabbie. 
production compagnie = Caramel Film 
Producer = Pauline Dhillon 
revenue = 0.2 millions of dollars 
Director = Jean-François Pouliot 
average note = 5.7 
budget = 293.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h41 
cast = Vinay Virmani, Kunal Nayyar, Isabelle Kaif, Adrianne Palicki 
tagline = Pay your doctor... by the meter... 
date of release = the 19 of September 2014 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does talk about the fact that the production company is caramel film.so, my answer is: correct!']
fact : production compagnie = Caramel Film 

In the heartwarming film "Dr. Cabbie," directed by Jean-François Pouliot and produced by Pauline Dhillon under Caramel Film, we follow the journey of a young Indian doctor who transforms his taxi into a mobile clinic, becoming a local hero in the process. Immigrating to Canada with the noble intention of healing others, our protagonist discovers his true purpose and love while navigating his dual roles as a doctor and a cabbie. Starring Vinay Virmani, Kunal Nayyar, Isabelle Kaif, and Adrianne Palicki, this uplifting tale is underscored by the tagline "Pay your doctor... by the meter." Despite its modest revenue of 0.2 million dollars against a budget of 293 million dollars, the film resonated with audiences, earning an average rating of 5.7. With a runtime of 1 hour and 41 minutes, "Dr. Cabbie" was released on the 19th of September 2014, captivating viewers with its inspiring narrative and memorable performances.

title = Abbott and Costello Meet Frankenstein 
overview = Two hapless frieght handlers find themselves encountering Dracula, the Frankenstein Monster and the Wolf Man. 
duration of the movie = 1h23 
budget = 108.6 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Universal International Pictures (UI) 
average note = 7.4 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Charles Barton 
cast = Bud Abbott, Lou Costello, Lon Chaney Jr., Bela Lugosi 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 15 of June 1948 
Producer = Robert Arthur 
revenue = 130.5 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does talk about the fact that the duration of the movie is 1h23.so, my answer is: correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h23 

In "Abbott and Costello Meet Frankenstein," directed by Charles Barton, two hapless freight handlers, played by Bud Abbott and Lou Costello, find themselves in a series of comedic encounters with classic monsters such as Dracula (Bela Lugosi), the Frankenstein Monster, and the Wolf Man (Lon Chaney Jr.). This classic film, produced by Universal International Pictures (UI) and released on the 15th of June 1948 in the United States of America, has an average rating of 7.4. With a budget of 108.6 million dollars, the movie, produced by Robert Arthur, went on to generate a revenue of 130.5 million dollars. The film runs for 1 hour and 23 minutes and is presented in its original English language.

title = Blow 
overview = A boy named George Jung grows up in a struggling family in the 1950's. His mother nags at her husband as he is trying to make a living for the family. It is finally revealed that George's father cannot make a living and the family goes bankrupt. George does not want the same thing to happen to him, and his friend Tuna, in the 1960's, suggests that he deal marijuana. He is a big hit in California in the 1960's, yet he goes to jail, where he finds out about the wonders of cocaine. As a result, when released, he gets rich by bringing cocaine to America. However, he soon pays the price. 
cast = Johnny Depp, Penélope Cruz, Ethan Suplee, Ray Liotta 
duration of the movie = 2h04 
Producer = Denis Leary 
production compagnie = New Line Cinema 
tagline = Based on a True Story. 
date of release = the 4 of April 2001 
revenue = 83.3 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 7.4 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the facts:* johnny depp* penélope cruz* ethan suplee* ray liottacorrect answer: the description does mention all the given actors.']
fact : cast = Johnny Depp, Penélope Cruz, Ethan Suplee, Ray Liotta 

In the riveting film "Blow," based on a true story, we follow the journey of George Jung, portrayed by the talented Johnny Depp. Growing up in the 1950s in a struggling family, George is determined to avoid the same financial hardships his family faced. With the help of his friend Tuna, he enters the world of marijuana dealing in the 1960s, eventually becoming a major player in California. However, his success takes a dark turn when he discovers the lucrative trade of cocaine while in jail. Upon his release, George becomes wealthy by smuggling cocaine into America, but his newfound riches come at a steep price. The stellar cast includes Penélope Cruz, Ethan Suplee, and Ray Liotta, delivering powerful performances that bring this gripping tale to life. Directed by Denis Leary and produced by New Line Cinema, "Blow" is a compelling exploration of the rise and fall of a notorious figure in the drug trade. Released on April 4, 2001, in the United States, the film garnered $83.3 million in revenue and received an average rating of 7.4. Don't miss this intense and captivating portrayal of one man's journey into the dangerous world of drug trafficking.
