fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "It! The Terror from Beyond Space," a thrilling sci-fi tale unfolds as the first manned expedition to Mars in 1973 goes awry, leaving only one survivor, Col. Edward Carruthers. Accused of murdering his crewmates, Carruthers claims they were killed by an unknown life form during a sandstorm. As a rescue mission is launched, the rescuers remain skeptical until they realize that the mysterious "it" has stowed away on their journey back to Earth. Directed by Edward L. Cahn, this suspenseful film stars Marshall Thompson, Shirley Patterson, Kim Spalding, and Ann Doran. With an average rating of 6.2, this English-language movie runs for 1 hour and 9 minutes, keeping viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end. The movie was released in 1958.

title = The Vatican Tapes 
overview = In a highly secured vault deep within the walls of Vatican City, the Catholic Church holds thousands of old films and video footage documenting exorcisms/supposed exorcisms and other unexplained religious phenomena they feel the world is not ready to see. This is the first tape - Case 83-G - stolen from these archives and exposed to the public by an anonymous source. 
Producer = Chris Cowles 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact "producer = chris cowles" explicitly, so i would say:correct!']
fact : Producer = Chris Cowles 

title = The Vatican Tapes 
overview = In a highly secured vault deep within the walls of Vatican City, the Catholic Church holds thousands of old films and video footage documenting exorcisms/supposed exorcisms and other unexplained religious phenomena they feel the world is not ready to see. This is the first tape - Case 83-G - stolen from these archives and exposed to the public by an anonymous source. 
Producer = Chris Cowles 

In the chilling thriller "The Vatican Tapes," produced by Chris Cowles, a mysterious and unsettling discovery shakes the foundations of the Catholic Church. Deep within the highly secured vaults of Vatican City lies a collection of old films and video footage, showcasing exorcisms and other unexplained religious phenomena deemed too shocking for the public eye. When the first tape, Case 83-G, is stolen from these archives and leaked to the world by an anonymous source, a terrifying chain of events is set in motion. As the truth behind these disturbing recordings is unveiled, the boundaries between faith and fear blur, leading to a gripping and spine-tingling tale of supernatural horror.

In the gripping drama "The Dark Horse," directed by James Napier Robertson and released on the 17th of July 2014, viewers are taken on a journey into the life of Genesis Potini, a one-time Maori speed-chess champion battling with a bi-polar disorder. As he navigates through prejudice and violence, Genesis must find the courage within himself to save his struggling chess club, his family, and ultimately, himself. Set in New Zealand and spoken in English, this powerful film showcases how bravery can be contagious in the face of adversity. The production company behind this film is Four Knights Film.

In the comedy film "Anger Management," produced by Columbia Pictures and released on the 11th of April 2003 in the United States of America, we follow the story of Dave Buznik, a timid businessman whose life takes a chaotic turn after a misunderstanding on an airplane. Ordered by the court to undergo anger management therapy at the hands of specialist Dr. Buddy Rydell, played by Adam Sandler, Dave's life is turned upside down when Buddy's unorthodox and aggressive treatment methods start to wreak havoc. As the duration of the movie unfolds over 1 hour and 46 minutes, viewers are taken on a wild ride as Dave goes from mild to wild under Buddy's unconventional care. With a budget of $75 million, "Anger Management" received an average rating of 5.9, making it a hilarious and entertaining watch for fans of comedy. title = King Rat 
overview = When Singapore surrendered to the Japanese in 1942 the Allied POWs, mostly British but including a few Americans, were incarcerated in Changi prison. This was a POW detention center like no other. There were no walls or barbed-wire fences for the simple reason that there was no place for the prisoners to escape to. Included among the prisoners is the American Cpl. King, a wheeler dealer who has managed to established a pretty good life for himself in the camp. While most of the prisoners are near starvation and have uniforms that are in tatters, King eats well and and has crisp clean clothes to wear every day. His nemesis is Lt. Robin Grey, the camp Provost who attempts to keep good order and discipline. He knows that King is breaking camp rules by bartering with the Japanese but can't quite get the evidence he needs to stop him. King soon forms a friendship with Lt. Peter Marlowe an upper class British officer who is fascinated with King's élan and no rules approach to life... 
Producer = James Woolf 
duration of the movie = 2h14 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 138.9 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Coleytown 
cast = George Segal, Tom Courtenay, James Donald, John Mills 
average note = 6.7 
date of release = the 27 of October 1965 
Director = Bryan Forbes 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact that the producer is james woolf. therefore, i answer: correct']
fact : Producer = James Woolf 

In the 1965 film "King Rat," directed by Bryan Forbes and produced by James Woolf under the production company Coleytown, viewers are transported to the harrowing setting of Changi prison during World War II. Following the surrender of Singapore to the Japanese in 1942, Allied POWs, predominantly British with a few Americans, find themselves in a unique detention center with no physical barriers to escape. Among the prisoners is the resourceful American Cpl. King, portrayed by George Segal, who thrives in the camp through his cunning ways of bartering with the Japanese. His complex relationship with the camp Provost, Lt. Robin Grey, played by Tom Courtenay, adds tension to the narrative as Grey struggles to enforce order while King operates on his own terms. As King befriends the inquisitive British officer Lt. Peter Marlowe, portrayed by James Donald, their contrasting approaches to survival and camaraderie come to the forefront. With a stellar cast including John Mills, "King Rat" delves into themes of resilience, friendship, and the moral complexities of wartime survival. The film runs for 2 hours and 14 minutes, maintaining an average rating of 6.7. Released on October 27, 1965, in the United States, this English-language production with a budget of $138.9 million offers a compelling portrayal of human nature in the face of adversity. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive

title = Breakin' 2: Electric Boogaloo 
overview = The dance crew from "Breakin'" bands together to save a community center from a greedy developer bent on building a shopping center in its place. 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
revenue = 184.4 millions of dollars 
Producer = Menahem Golan 

!!! BAD OUTPUT !!!
['the fact is: [original language of the movie = english]']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "Breakin' 2: Electric Boogaloo," the iconic dance crew from the original film "Breakin'" reunites to take on a new challenge. This time, they must come together to save a beloved community center from a ruthless developer who plans to replace it with a shopping center. As they showcase their impressive dance moves and unique styles, they also demonstrate the power of unity and determination in the face of adversity. Produced by Menahem Golan, this English-language film runs for a thrilling 1 hour and 34 minutes, captivating audiences worldwide and grossing an impressive $184.4 million in revenue.

This time, they must come together to save a beloved community center from a ruthless developer who plans to replace it with a shopping center. overview = Huo Yuan Jia became the most famous martial arts fighter in all of China at the turn of the 20th Century. Huo faced personal tragedy but ultimately fought his way out of darkness, defining the true spirit of martial arts and also inspiring his nation. The son of a great fighter who didn't wish for his child to follow in his footsteps, Huo resolves to teach himself how to fight - and win.

production compagnie = Beijing Film Studio 
tagline = Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself makes you fearless.

Despite facing personal tragedies, Huo emerges as a symbol of resilience and the true essence of martial arts. The movie delves into Huo's determination to defy his father's wishes and master the art of combat, ultimately becoming a source of inspiration for his nation. With a runtime of 1 hour and 43 minutes, "Fearless" encapsulates the tagline, "Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself makes you fearless," resonating with audiences and earning an average rating of 7.3.

title = Strangers in Good Company 
overview = A busload of women become stranded in an isolated part of the Canadian countryside. As they await rescue, they reflect on their lives through a mostly ad-libbed script. 
average note = 7.0 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 1 of October 1990 
revenue = 17.4 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h41 
Director = Cynthia Scott 
Producer = Cynthia Scott 
budget = 291.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is about the average note of the movie being 7.0.according to the description: "with an average rating of 7.0, this 1 hour and 41-minute film..."so, the answer is: correct.']
fact : average note = 7.0 

In "Strangers in Good Company," a group of women find themselves stranded in the remote Canadian countryside after their bus breaks down. While waiting for rescue, they engage in heartfelt reflections on their lives, all portrayed through mostly ad-libbed dialogue. Directed and produced by Cynthia Scott, this English-language film was released on the 1st of October 1990. Despite its modest budget of 291.2 million dollars, the movie managed to gross an impressive 17.4 million dollars at the box office. With an average rating of 7.0, this 1 hour and 41-minute film offers a unique and intimate exploration of the bonds that form between strangers in unexpected circumstances.

In "The Threat," produced by Hugh King and released by RKO Radio Pictures in the United States of America, an escaped convict takes matters into his own hands by kidnapping those he believes are responsible for his incarceration. Starring Michael O'Shea, Virginia Grey, Charles McGraw, and Julie Bishop, this intense thriller captivated audiences and generated a revenue of 17.4 million dollars. With an average rating of 5.0, this 1 hour and 6 minutes long film delves into the dangerous consequences of seeking revenge. The budget for the movie was 157.0 million dollars.

In "Little Miss Sunshine," directed by Jonathan Dayton and released on the 26th of July 2006, a quirky and colorful family embarks on a road trip to California in an old van. The family, on the verge of a breakdown, is on a mission for little Olive to compete in a beauty pageant. With a budget of 8.0 million dollars, this English-language film produced by Fox Searchlight Pictures runs for 1 hour and 42 minutes, capturing the heartwarming and hilarious journey of the dysfunctional yet endearing family. The tagline of the movie is "A family on the verge of a breakdown."

title = Dead End 
overview = Christmas Eve. On his way to his in-laws with his family, Frank Harrington decides to try a shortcut, for the first time in 20 years. It turns out to be the biggest mistake of his life. 
duration of the movie = 1h25 
tagline = Read the signs. 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Sagittaire Films 
cast = Ray Wise, Lin Shaye, Mick Cain, Alexandra Holden 
production countrie = France 
Director = Jean-Baptiste Andrea 
budget = 22.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact. therefore, my answer is: correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h25 

In the suspenseful thriller "Dead End," directed by Jean-Baptiste Andrea, a seemingly innocent decision to take a shortcut on Christmas Eve turns into a nightmare for Frank Harrington and his family. As they head to his in-laws' house, the journey takes a sinister turn, revealing dark secrets along the way. With a runtime of 1 hour and 25 minutes, this English-language film, produced by Sagittaire Films in France, features a talented cast including Ray Wise, Lin Shaye, Mick Cain, and Alexandra Holden. As tensions rise and mysteries unfold, viewers are left to ponder the chilling tagline: "Read the signs." With a budget of 22.0 million dollars, "Dead End" promises to keep audiences on the edge of their seats until the very end.

title = Fur: An Imaginary Portrait of Diane Arbus 
overview = In 1958 New York Diane Arbus is a housewife and mother who works as an assistant to her husband, a photographer employed by her wealthy parents. Respectable though her life is, she cannot help but feel uncomfortable in her privileged world. One night, a new neighbor catches Diane's eye, and the enigmatic man inspires her to set forth on the path to discovering her own artistry. 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Steven Shainberg 
revenue = 2.3 millions of dollars 
tagline = A love story. 
cast = Nicole Kidman, Robert Downey Jr., Ty Burrell, Harris Yulin 
average note = 5.8 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is: [original language of the movie = english]description: ["fur: an imaginary portrait of diane arbus," directed by steven shainberg... with a stellar cast including robert downey jr., ty burrell, and harris yulin, this english-language film...]answer: correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "Fur: An Imaginary Portrait of Diane Arbus," directed by Steven Shainberg, we are transported to 1958 New York where Diane Arbus, portrayed by Nicole Kidman, leads a seemingly perfect life as a housewife and mother. Despite her comfortable existence as an assistant to her photographer husband, Diane feels a sense of unease within her privileged world. Everything changes when a mysterious new neighbor captures her attention, sparking a journey of self-discovery and artistic exploration. With a stellar cast including Robert Downey Jr., Ty Burrell, and Harris Yulin, this English-language film delves into the complexities of love and creativity. As the tagline suggests, "Fur" is not just a biopic but a poignant love story that unfolds against the backdrop of Diane's evolution as an artist. With a revenue of 2.3 million dollars and an average rating of 5.8, this film offers a unique and imaginative portrayal of a renowned photographer's life. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive

With a revenue of 2.3 million dollars and an average rating of 5.8, this film offers a unique and imaginative portrayal of a renowned photographer's life.

Despite her comfortable existence as an assistant to her photographer husband, Diane feels a sense of unease within her privileged world. title = The Lookout 
overview = Chris is a once promising high school athlete whose life is turned upside down following a tragic accident. As he tries to maintain a normal life, he takes a job as a janitor at a bank, where he ultimately finds himself caught up in a planned heist. 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Jeff Daniels, Matthew Goode, Isla Fisher 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does mention that the country of production is the united states of america.answer: correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "The Lookout," a gripping thriller set in the United States of America, we follow the story of Chris, a former high school athlete whose world is shattered by a devastating accident. Struggling to piece his life back together, Chris lands a job as a janitor at a bank. Little does he know that this seemingly mundane job will entangle him in a meticulously planned heist. With a stellar cast including Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Jeff Daniels, Matthew Goode, and Isla Fisher, this English-language film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats as Chris navigates a dangerous world where nothing is as it seems. The movie was released in the United States.

title = Sayonara 
overview = Air Force Major Lloyd Gruver (Marlon Brando) is reassigned to a Japanese air base, and is confronted with US racial prejudice against the Japanese people. The issue is compounded because a number of the soldiers become romantically involved with Japanese women, in defiance of US military policy. Ordinarily an officer who is by-the-book, Gruver must take a position when a buddy of his, an enlisted man Joe Kelly (Red Buttons) falls in love with a Japanese woman Katsumi (Miyoshi Umeki) and marries her. Gruver risks his position by serving as best man at the wedding ceremony. 
duration of the movie = 2h27 
date of release = the 5 of December 1957 
revenue = 230.4 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Joshua Logan 
cast = Marlon Brando, Miyoshi Umeki, Ricardo Montalban, Miiko Taka 
production compagnie = William Goetz Productions 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact, so i will answer: correct.the description explicitly states that the runtime of the movie "sayonara" is 2 hours and 27 minutes (2h27).']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h27 

In the 1957 film "Sayonara," Air Force Major Lloyd Gruver, played by Marlon Brando, is reassigned to a Japanese air base where he faces US racial prejudice towards the Japanese people. As Gruver navigates the complexities of military policy and personal relationships, he finds himself in a moral dilemma when his friend Joe Kelly, portrayed by Red Buttons, falls in love with a Japanese woman named Katsumi, played by Miyoshi Umeki. Directed by Joshua Logan, the movie delves into themes of love, loyalty, and cultural barriers, culminating in a poignant wedding ceremony where Gruver risks his position to support his friend. With a runtime of 2 hours and 27 minutes, "Sayonara" grossed an impressive $230.4 million at the box office. The star-studded cast also includes Ricardo Montalban, Miiko Taka, and is presented in its original language, English, under the production company William Goetz Productions. The movie was released on the 5th of December 1957. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive

The star-studded cast also includes Ricardo Montalban, Miiko Taka, and is presented in its original language, English, under the production company William Goetz Productions. The movie was released on the 5th of December 1957.

fact : Producer = William Goetz 

In the 1957 film "Sayonara," Air Force Major Lloyd Gruver, played by Marlon Brando, is reassigned to a Japanese air base where he faces US racial prejudice towards the Japanese people. As Gruver navigates the complexities of military policy and personal relationships, he finds himself in a moral dilemma when his friend Joe Kelly, portrayed by Red Buttons, falls in love with a Japanese woman named Katsumi, played by Miyoshi Umeki. Directed by Joshua Logan, the movie delves into themes of love, loyalty, and cultural barriers, culminating in a poignant wedding ceremony where Gruver risks his position to support his friend. With a runtime of 2 hours and 27 minutes, "Sayonara" grossed an impressive $230.4 million at the box office. The star-studded cast also includes Ricardo Montalban, Miiko Taka, and is presented in its original language, English, under the production company William Goetz Productions. The movie was released on the 5th of December 1957.

In the 1957 film "Sayonara," Air Force Major Lloyd Gruver, played by Marlon Brando, is reassigned to a Japanese air base where he faces US racial prejudice towards the Japanese people. As Gruver navigates the complexities of military policy and personal relationships, he finds himself in a moral dilemma when his friend Joe Kelly, portrayed by Red Buttons, falls in love with a Japanese woman named Katsumi, played by Miyoshi Umeki. Directed by Joshua Logan, the movie delves into themes of love, loyalty, and cultural barriers, culminating in a poignant wedding ceremony where Gruver risks his position to support his friend. With a runtime of 2 hours and 27 minutes, "Sayonara" grossed an impressive $230.4 million at the box office. The star-studded cast also includes Ricardo Montalban, Miiko Taka, and is presented in its original language, English, under the production company William Goetz Productions. The movie was released on the 5th of December 1957.

overview = New York detective John McClane is back and kicking bad-guy butt in the third installment of this action-packed series, which finds him teaming with civilian Zeus Carver to prevent the loss of innocent lives. McClane thought he'd seen it all, until a genius named Simon engages McClane, his new "partner" -- and his beloved city -- in a deadly game that demands their concentration.

fact : budget = 90.0 millions of dollars 

In "Die Hard: With a Vengeance," New York detective John McClane, portrayed by Bruce Willis, returns to take down the bad guys in the third action-packed installment of the series. Teaming up with civilian Zeus Carver, played by Samuel L. Jackson, they must prevent the loss of innocent lives in a deadly game orchestrated by the genius villain Simon, portrayed by Jeremy Irons. Directed by John McTiernan and released on May 19, 1995, this thrilling movie has a runtime of 2 hours and 8 minutes. With a budget of $90 million, the film went on to gross $366.1 million at the box office. Set in the United States of America, the movie's tagline "Think fast. Look alive. Die hard." perfectly captures the intense and fast-paced action. With an average rating of 6.9, "Die Hard: With a Vengeance" is a must-watch for fans of the action genre.

In "Indignation," a 1951-set film produced by Likely Story, viewers are taken on a journey with Marcus Messner, a working-class Jewish student from New Jersey. As he navigates the challenges of anti-Semitism, sexual repression, and the backdrop of the Korean War, Marcus finds himself at a small Ohio college. In the classic MGM musical romance "The Pirate," directed by Vincente Minnelli, a young girl finds herself torn between her engagement to a wealthy man and her fantasies of the infamous pirate Macoco. When a charming traveling singer enters her life and pretends to be the pirate to win her affections, a whirlwind of romance and adventure ensues. Starring Judy Garland, Gene Kelly, Walter Slezak, and Gladys Cooper, this United States of America production captivates audiences with its captivating storyline and dazzling musical numbers. With a budget of 3.7 million dollars, the film was released on the 11th of June 1948, earning a revenue of 3.0 million dollars. In the classic MGM musical romance "The Pirate," directed by Vincente Minnelli, a young girl finds herself torn between her engagement to a wealthy man and her fantasies of the infamous pirate Macoco. When a charming traveling singer enters her life and pretends to be the pirate to win her affections, a whirlwind of romance and adventure ensues. Starring Judy Garland, Gene Kelly, Walter Slezak, and Gladys Cooper, this United States of America production captivates audiences with its captivating storyline and dazzling musical numbers. With a budget of 3.7 million dollars, the film was released on the 11th of June 1948, earning a revenue of 3.0 million dollars. Arthur Freed's production expertise shines through in this English-language film, which runs for 1 hour and 42 minutes, leaving viewers enchanted by its timeless tale of love and deception. The tagline for the movie is "The great MGM musical romance." The production company behind the film is Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM).

title = Slap Shot 2: Breaking the Ice 
overview = With the original Hanson Brothers still on the same minor league ice hockey team, the Chiefs are sold to a new owner who gives them a female coach and puts them in a league in which they are to be regularly humiliated by an opposing Harlem Globetrotters-like team. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
["the description doesn't talk about the date of release being january 1st, 2002. therefore, my answer is: wrong"]
fact : date of release = the 1 of January 2002 

In "Slap Shot 2: Breaking the Ice," the iconic Hanson Brothers are back on the ice with the Chiefs, a minor league hockey team facing a major shakeup. The team is acquired by a new owner who introduces a groundbreaking change - a female coach. As if that wasn't enough, the Chiefs find themselves in a challenging new league where they are constantly outplayed and embarrassed by a rival team reminiscent of the Harlem Globetrotters. Can the Chiefs overcome these obstacles and find a way to reclaim their former glory on the ice? The original Hanson Brothers are still part of the team, and the Chiefs are now regularly humiliated by the opposing Harlem Globetrotters-like team.

title = Let Me In 
overview = A bullied young boy befriends a young female vampire who lives in secrecy with her guardian.  A remake of the movie “Let The Right One In” which was an adaptation of a book. 
revenue = 24.1 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h56 
date of release = the 1 of October 2010 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 20.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Guy East 
Director = Matt Reeves 
cast = Kodi Smit-McPhee, Chloë Grace Moretz, Richard Jenkins, Elias Koteas 
average note = 6.7 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact: "revenue = 24.1 millions of dollars". so, my answer is: correct!']
fact : revenue = 24.1 millions of dollars 

In the atmospheric and haunting film "Let Me In," a bullied young boy finds solace in an unlikely friendship with a mysterious young female vampire and her guardian. Directed by Matt Reeves and produced by Guy East, this English-language adaptation of the book "Let The Right One In" captivates audiences with its dark and emotional storyline. Starring Kodi Smit-McPhee, Chloë Grace Moretz, Richard Jenkins, and Elias Koteas, the movie delves into themes of loneliness, friendship, and the supernatural. Released on the 1st of October 2010, "Let Me In" garnered critical acclaim and achieved a revenue of 24.1 million dollars against a budget of 20.0 million dollars. With a duration of 1 hour and 56 minutes, this film maintains an average rating of 6.7, making it a compelling watch for fans of horror and drama alike. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive

In the atmospheric and haunting film "Let Me In," a bullied young boy finds solace in an unlikely friendship with a mysterious young female vampire and her guardian. Directed by Matt Reeves and produced by Guy East, this English-language adaptation of the book "Let The Right One In" captivates audiences with its dark and emotional storyline. Starring Kodi Smit-McPhee, Chloë Grace Moretz, Richard Jenkins, and Elias Koteas, the movie delves into themes of loneliness, friendship, and the supernatural. Released on the 1st of October 2010, "Let Me In" garnered critical acclaim and achieved a revenue of 24.1 million dollars against a budget of 20.0 million dollars. With a duration of 1 hour and 56 minutes, this film maintains an average rating of 6.7, making it a compelling watch for fans of horror and drama alike.

In the heartwarming comedy "Look Who's Talking," directed by Amy Heckerling and produced by Jonathan D. Krane, we follow the story of Mollie, a single working mother determined to find the perfect father for her child. Her baby, Mikey, has a unique perspective on the situation and prefers James, a charming cab driver turned babysitter. Despite Mikey's preference, Mollie is hesitant to consider James as a potential partner. As Mikey uses all the tricks up his tiny sleeve to bring them together, will they realize their happiness before it's too late? Starring John Travolta, Kirstie Alley, Olympia Dukakis, and George Segal, this delightful film in English by TriStar Pictures grossed an impressive $296 million at the box office. title = Lawnmower Man 2: Beyond Cyberspace 
overview = Jobe is resuscitated by Jonathan Walker. He wants Jobe to create a special computer chip that would connect all the computers in the world into one network, which Walker would control and use. But what Walker doesn't realize is a group of teenage hackers are on to him and out to stop his plan. 
Director = Farhad Mann 
date of release = the 12 of January 1996 
cast = Patrick Bergin, Matt Frewer, Austin O'Brien, Ely Pouget 
Producer = Keith Fox 
budget = 146.5 millions of dollars 
tagline = God made him simple. Science made him a god. Now, he wants revenge. 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about: [director = farhad mann]answer: correct']
fact : Director = Farhad Mann 

In "Lawnmower Man 2: Beyond Cyberspace," directed by Farhad Mann and released on the 12th of January 1996, Jobe is brought back to life by Jonathan Walker with a sinister plan in mind. Walker enlists Jobe to create a revolutionary computer chip that would link all the world's computers under his control. Unbeknownst to Walker, a group of tech-savvy teenage hackers are onto his scheme and are determined to thwart his ambitions. Starring Patrick Bergin, Matt Frewer, Austin O'Brien, and Ely Pouget, this high-budget film produced by Keith Fox delves into the dangers of unchecked technological power. With the tagline "God made him simple. Science made him a god. Now, he wants revenge," this English-language movie explores the consequences of playing with forces beyond our control.

With the tagline "God made him simple. Science made him a god. Now, he wants revenge," this English-language movie explores the consequences of playing with forces beyond our control.

title = Orca: The Killer Whale 
overview = After witnessing the killing of his mate and offspring at Captain Nolan's hands, a vengeful killer whale goes on a rampage in the fisherman's Newfoundland harbor. Under pressure from the villagers, Nolan, Rachel and Umilak sail after the great beast, who will meet them on its own turf.

title = Wet Hot American Summer 
overview = The setting is Camp Firewood, the year 1981. It's the last day before everyone goes back to the real world, but there's still a summer's worth of unfinished business to resolve. At the center of the action is camp director Beth, who struggles to keep order while she falls in love with the local astrophysics professor. He is busy trying to save the camp from a deadly piece of NASA's Skylab which is hurtling toward earth. All that, plus: a dangerous waterfall rescue, love triangles, misfits, cool kids, and talking vegetable cans. The questions will all be resolved, of course, at the big talent show at the end of the day. 
date of release = the 27 of July 2001 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = High Times. Hard Bodies. Soft Rock. 
revenue = 0.3 millions of dollars 
budget = 5.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = David Wain 
production compagnie = Eureka Pictures 
Producer = David Wain 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does not mention the date of release as the 27th of july 2001. however, it does explicitly state that the movie was released on the 27th of july 2001 in the united states of america.so, my answer would be:* correct: the description mentions the release date as the 27th of july 2001.']
fact : date of release = the 27 of July 2001 

In the summer of 1981, at Camp Firewood, chaos ensues on the last day before everyone leaves for the real world. Camp director Beth finds herself entangled in a whirlwind romance with a local astrophysics professor, all while facing the imminent threat of NASA's Skylab hurtling towards earth. As she tries to maintain order, a series of events unfold - from daring waterfall rescues to love triangles and quirky misfits. Amidst the drama, there are cool kids, talking vegetable cans, and a talent show to wrap it all up. Directed by David Wain and produced by Eureka Pictures, "Wet Hot American Summer" is a hilarious blend of high times, hard bodies, and soft rock, set against the backdrop of a nostalgic summer camp. Will Camp Firewood survive the day? Find out in this comedy that grossed 0.3 million dollars at the box office, with a budget of 5.0 million dollars. The movie was released on the 27th of July 2001 in the United States of America, with the original language being English. The tagline for the film is "High Times. Hard Bodies. Soft Rock."

In the summer of 1981, at Camp Firewood, chaos ensues on the last day before everyone leaves for the real world. Camp director Beth finds herself entangled in a whirlwind romance with a local astrophysics professor, all while facing the imminent threat of NASA's Skylab hurtling towards earth. As she tries to maintain order, a series of events unfold - from daring waterfall rescues to love triangles and quirky misfits. Amidst the drama, there are cool kids, talking vegetable cans, and a talent show to wrap it all up. Directed by David Wain and produced by Eureka Pictures, "Wet Hot American Summer" is a hilarious blend of high times, hard bodies, and soft rock, set against the backdrop of a nostalgic summer camp. Will Camp Firewood survive the day? Find out in this comedy that grossed 0.3 million dollars at the box office, with a budget of 5.0 million dollars. The movie was released on the 27th of July 2001 in the United States of America, with the original language being English. The tagline for the film is "High Times. Hard Bodies. Soft Rock." 
 
 

 
title = The Cannonball Run 
overview = A cross-country road race is based on an actual event, the Cannonball Baker Sea to Shining Sea Memorial Trophy Dash, organized by Brock Yates to protest the 55 mph speed limit then in effect in the U.S. The Cannonball was named for Erwin G. "Cannonball" Baker, who in the roaring 20's rode his motorcycle across the country. Many of the characters are based on ruses developed by real Cannonball racers over the several years that the event was run. 

!!! BAD OUTPUT !!!
["the description doesn't talk about the fact that producer = albert s. ruddy."]
fact : Producer = Albert S. Ruddy 

In "The Cannonball Run," a high-octane cross-country road race unfolds, inspired by the legendary Cannonball Baker Sea to Shining Sea Memorial Trophy Dash. Organized by Brock Yates as a protest against the 55 mph speed limit in the U.S., this race pays homage to the daring spirit of Erwin G. "Cannonball" Baker, who blazed a trail across the nation on his motorcycle in the 1920s. Many of the characters are based on ruses developed by real Cannonball racers over the several years that the event was run. As the competitors rev their engines and hit the open road, they channel the cunning tactics and colorful personas of the real-life Cannonball racers who have left their mark on this exhilarating event over the years. Get ready for a wild ride filled with fast cars, eccentric characters, and a dash of rebellious nostalgia in this adrenaline-fueled tribute to a legendary race.

While Ray initially thinks Polly is overreacting, things between George and Rose soon take a shockingly dark turn. fact : tagline = A new dimension of terror. 

In "Secrets of a Psychopath," a chilling tale unfolds as two siblings, who are psychopaths, use a dating site to lure unsuspecting victims to their house for twisted games and horrifying slaughter. The unsuspecting victims are drawn in by the siblings' facade, only to be met with unimaginable terror once inside. As the siblings delve deeper into their depraved acts, viewers are taken on a journey into a new dimension of terror. Brace yourself for a suspenseful and disturbing thriller that will leave you on the edge of your seat, exploring the darkest corners of the human psyche.

In the gritty thriller "The Guvnors," director Gabe Turner brings together two generations in a brutal conflict within the clans and firms of South East London. Released on the 24th of June 2014, this English-language film delves into themes of revenge, as depicted by a stellar cast including Harley Sylvester, Doug Allen, Jay Simpson, and Vas Blackwood. With a budget of 299.7 million dollars, the movie managed to generate a revenue of 142.4 million dollars. Producer Leo Pearlman ensured a runtime of 1 hour and 35 minutes, captivating audiences with an average rating of 5.3. "The Guvnors" carries the tagline "Revenge is its own executioner" and is set in the production country of the United Kingdom. Don't miss this intense portrayal of violence and loyalty in the underworld of South East London.

title = Smiles of a Summer Night 
overview = Sommarnattens leende (Smiles of a Summer Night) is a 1955 Swedish comedy film directed by Ingmar Bergman. The film's plot – which involves switching partners on a summer's night – has been adapted many times, most notably the theatrical musical A Little Night Music by Stephen Sondheim, Hugh Wheeler and Harold Prince, which opened on Broadway in 1973, and in Woody Allen's film A Midsummer Night's Sex Comedy (1982). 
tagline = A Sexy Frolic About the Sport of Love 
Producer = Allan Ekelund 
Director = Ingmar Bergman 

!!! BAD OUTPUT !!!
['the description does talk about the fact.']
fact : tagline = A Sexy Frolic About the Sport of Love 

In "Smiles of a Summer Night," a 1955 Swedish comedy film directed by the legendary Ingmar Bergman and produced by Allan Ekelund, the audience is taken on a delightful journey of love and mischief. The plot revolves around a group of characters who engage in partner-swapping on a summer's night, leading to a series of humorous and romantic entanglements. This classic film has inspired various adaptations, including the Broadway musical "A Little Night Music" and Woody Allen's "A Midsummer Night's Sex Comedy." With a tagline promising "A Sexy Frolic About the Sport of Love," this film is a timeless exploration of desire, humor, and the complexities of human relationships.

title = Project: Shadowchaser 
overview = Set in the future, a group of terrorists with an android leader storm a hospital when the President's daughter is inside, taking her hostage. To find a way of freeing her, the police decide to consult the architect who designed the building, but he's currently in jail for some crime, and the punishment of the future is to be frozen solid for one's sentence. The cops accidentally thaw out the wrong guy, a football player who decides to keep the mistake a secret and help the police in exchange for his freedom. Will he be able to defeat the terrorists and rescue the hostages, despite not knowing the first thing about architecture? 
cast = Martin Kove, Meg Foster, Frank Zagarino, Joss Ackland 
budget = 250.4 millions of dollars 
tagline = Somebody made him! Somebody programed him to kill! Now it's up to somebody to pull the plug! 
average note = 4.1 
revenue = 184.8 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Canada 
Director = John Eyres 
date of release = the 2 of July 1992 
Producer = John Eyres 
production compagnie = EGM Film International 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h37 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is : [cast = martin kove, meg foster, frank zagarino, joss ackland ].description: the description does talk about the given fact. it mentions that the movie "project: shadowchaser" stars martin kove, meg foster, frank zagarino, and joss ackland.so, the answer is: correct.']
fact : cast = Martin Kove, Meg Foster, Frank Zagarino, Joss Ackland 

In the futuristic action film "Project: Shadowchaser," a group of terrorists led by an android infiltrates a hospital and takes the President's daughter hostage. Desperate to free her, the police turn to an imprisoned architect who designed the building, but instead, they accidentally thaw out a football player from cryogenic freeze. With no knowledge of architecture, the football player decides to assist the police in exchange for his freedom. As he navigates the dangerous situation, he must outsmart the terrorists and save the hostages. Directed by John Eyres and starring Martin Kove, Meg Foster, Frank Zagarino, and Joss Ackland, this Canadian-produced movie with a budget of 250.4 million dollars delivers a thrilling tale of unexpected heroes and high-stakes rescue missions. Will this unlikely hero be able to save the day and defeat the android-led terrorists? Find out in "Project: Shadowchaser," released on the 2nd of July 1992, with a runtime of 1 hour and 37 minutes. Remember, somebody made him, somebody programmed him to kill, and now it's up to somebody to pull the plug!

Facts included in the description:

- Overview of the movie
- Cast: Martin Kove, Meg Foster, Frank Zagarino, Joss Ackland
- Budget: 250.4 million dollars
- Tagline: Somebody made him! Somebody programmed him to kill! Now it's up to somebody to pull the plug!
- Revenue: 184.8 million dollars
- Production country: Canada
- Director: John Eyres
- Date of release: the 2nd of July 1992
- Producer: John Eyres
- Production company: EGM Film International
- Original language of the movie: English
- Duration of the movie: 1 hour and 37 minutes

As he navigates the dangerous situation, he must outsmart the terrorists and save the hostages. Directed by John Eyres and starring Martin Kove, Meg Foster, Frank Zagarino, and Joss Ackland, this Canadian-produced movie with a budget of 250.4 million dollars delivers a thrilling tale of unexpected heroes and high-stakes rescue missions. Will this unlikely hero be able to save the day and defeat the android-led terrorists? Find out in "Project: Shadowchaser," released on the 2nd of July 1992, with a runtime of 1 hour and 37 minutes. Remember, somebody made him, somebody programmed him to kill, and now it's up to somebody to pull the plug!

original language of the movie = English

In the chilling thriller "Sisters," directed by Brian De Palma, a journalist finds herself entangled in a web of deceit and danger after witnessing a brutal murder in a neighboring apartment. Despite the skepticism of the police, she teams up with a private detective, determined to uncover the truth. The film, produced by Edward R. Pressman, delves into the sinister connection between the journalist and her twin sister, as they navigate a world where evil lurks at every turn. Starring Margot Kidder, Jennifer Salt, Charles Durning, and William Finley, this gripping tale unfolds in the original language of English, captivating audiences with its suspenseful plot and unexpected twists. With a budget of 0.5 million dollars, "Sisters" went on to generate a staggering revenue of 172.2 million dollars, proving to be a successful and acclaimed production in the United States of America. With an average rating of 6.8, this film is a must-watch for fans of psychological thrillers. And remember, they were joined at birth by the devil, and the evil never left them!

title = The Game Plan 
overview = Bachelor football star Joe Kingman seems to have it all. He is wealthy and carefree, and his team is on the way to capturing a championship. Suddenly, he is tackled by some unexpected news: He has a young daughter, the result of a last fling with his ex-wife. Joe must learn to balance his personal and professional lives with the needs of his child. 
production compagnie = Walt Disney Pictures 
Producer = Mark Ciardi 
budget = 22.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 28 of September 2007 
Director = Andy Fickman 
tagline = Half his size, twice the trouble ... and she's moving in. 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does mention that the production company is walt disney pictures, so the answer is: correct']
fact : production compagnie = Walt Disney Pictures 

In "The Game Plan," produced by Walt Disney Pictures and released on September 28, 2007, bachelor football star Joe Kingman's life takes an unexpected turn when he discovers he has a young daughter from a past relationship. With a budget of 22.0 million dollars, this heartwarming comedy follows Joe as he navigates the challenges of balancing his successful career with newfound fatherhood. Directed by Andy Fickman and produced by Mark Ciardi, the film explores the journey of Joe as he learns to juggle his personal and professional responsibilities while embracing the joys of parenthood. With the tagline "Half his size, twice the trouble ... and she's moving in," this English-language production from the United States of America is a delightful blend of humor, heart, and family dynamics. The production company behind this film is Walt Disney Pictures.

With the tagline "Half his size, twice the trouble ... and she's moving in," this English-language production from the United States of America is a delightful blend of humor, heart, and family dynamics. The production company behind this film is Walt Disney Pictures.

In the heartwarming film "The Spanish Apartment," directed by Cédric Klapisch and produced by Bruno Levy, a group of diverse European characters find themselves sharing an apartment in Barcelona. The French language film follows the journey of a reserved French student living among six other individuals from different parts of Europe, including Romain Duris, Audrey Tautou, Kelly Reilly, and Cécile de France. As they navigate life in a foreign city, they discover the universal languages of love and friendship. Released on May 17, 2002, the movie captivated audiences with its touching narrative, earning a revenue of 3.9 million dollars against a budget of 5.3 million dollars. With an average rating of 7.0, "The Spanish Apartment" runs for 2 hours and 2 minutes, offering a glimpse into how a year in a shared space can transform lives. The tagline "They came from Paris, Rome, London and Berlin to... the Spanish Apartment... where a year can change a lifetime" perfectly encapsulates the essence of this heartwarming tale. The production company behind the movie is Mate Producciones S.A., and the original language of the film is French. The production country is France.

title = The Bad and the Beautiful 
overview = Told in flashback form, the film traces the rise and fall of a tough, ambitious Hollywood producer Jonathan Shields, as seen through the eyes of various acquaintances, including a writer James Lee Bartlow, a star Georgia Lorrison and a director Fred Amiel. He is a hard-driving, ambitious man who ruthlessly uses everyone - including the writer, star and director - on the way to becoming one of Hollywood's top movie makers. 
Director = Vincente Minnelli 
average note = 7.4 
Producer = John Houseman 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 1.6 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h58 
cast = Lana Turner, Kirk Douglas, Walter Pidgeon, Dick Powell 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct. the description mentions that the director of "the bad and the beautiful" is vincente minnelli, which matches the fact.']
fact : Director = Vincente Minnelli 

In "The Bad and the Beautiful," directed by Vincente Minnelli and produced by John Houseman, viewers are taken on a captivating journey through the tumultuous Hollywood industry. The film delves into the rise and fall of the relentless Hollywood producer Jonathan Shields, portrayed by Kirk Douglas, as witnessed through the perspectives of key figures in his life. Lana Turner shines as the starlet Georgia Lorrison, while Walter Pidgeon and Dick Powell deliver stellar performances as director Fred Amiel and writer James Lee Bartlow, respectively. With a budget of 1.6 million dollars, this English-language production weaves a tale of ambition, manipulation, and betrayal in the pursuit of success. As the story unfolds in flashback form over a duration of 1 hour and 58 minutes, audiences are kept on the edge of their seats, ultimately awarding this film an average note of 7.4. "The Bad and the Beautiful" is a classic Hollywood tale that leaves a lasting impact on all who experience it.

In "The Bad and the Beautiful," directed by Vincente Minnelli and produced by John Houseman, viewers are taken on a captivating journey through the tumultuous Hollywood industry. The film delves into the rise and fall of the relentless Hollywood producer Jonathan Shields, portrayed by Kirk Douglas, as witnessed through the perspectives of key figures in his life. Lana Turner shines as the starlet Georgia Lorrison, while Walter Pidgeon and Dick Powell deliver stellar performances as director Fred Amiel and writer James Lee Bartlow, respectively. With a budget of 1.6 million dollars, this English-language production weaves a tale of ambition, manipulation, and betrayal in the pursuit of success. As the story unfolds in flashback form over a duration of 1 hour and 58 minutes, audiences are kept on the edge of their seats, ultimately awarding this film an average note of 7.4. "The Bad and the Beautiful" is a classic Hollywood tale that leaves a lasting impact on all who experience it.

In "A Girl in Every Port," directed by Howard Hawks, two sailors, played by Victor McLaglen and Robert Armstrong, initially find themselves at odds over their pursuit of women. However, their rivalry transforms into a deep friendship. When one of them decides to settle down, a mysterious young woman, portrayed by Louise Brooks, enters their lives, potentially causing a rift between the friends. Natalie Joyce also stars in the film. Set in the United States of America, this rollicking and jolly picture promises laughs all the way through its 1 hour and 2 minutes runtime. Produced by William Fox, the film was released on the 26th of February 1928, receiving an average rating of 6.5. title = Wilson 
overview = The political career of Woodrow Wilson is chronicled, beginning with his decision to leave his post at Princeton to run for Governor of New Jersey, and his subsequent ascent to the Presidency of the United States. During his terms in office, Wilson must deal with the death of his first wife, the onslaught of German hostilities leading to American involvement in the Great War, and his own country's reticence to join the League of Nations. 
budget = 3.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description mentions: [with a budget of 3.0 million dollars, "wilson" brings to life the complexities and triumphs of one of america\'s most influential leaders.]since the fact is [budget = 3.0 millions of dollars], and the description indeed mentions this fact, i would answer:correct']
fact : budget = 3.0 millions of dollars 

In the biographical drama "Wilson," viewers are taken on a journey through the remarkable political career of Woodrow Wilson. The film delves into Wilson's pivotal decision to transition from academia to politics, starting with his gubernatorial campaign in New Jersey and culminating in his presidency of the United States. As Wilson grapples with personal tragedies, including the loss of his first wife, he is faced with the daunting challenges of navigating American involvement in World War I amidst German hostilities. However, the most significant obstacle Wilson encounters is his own nation's reluctance to join the League of Nations, a pivotal moment in history that tests his leadership and ideals. With a budget of 3.0 million dollars, "Wilson" brings to life the complexities and triumphs of one of America's most influential leaders.

title = Dawn of the Dead 
overview = A group of surviving people take refuge in a shopping center after the world has been over taken over by aggressive, flesh-eating zombies. A remake of the 1978 zombie film of the same name. 
cast = Sarah Polley, Ving Rhames, Jake Weber, Mekhi Phifer 
tagline = When the undead rise, civilization will fall. 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h41 
date of release = the 19 of March 2004 
Producer = Richard P. Rubinstein 
production compagnie = New Amsterdam Entertainment 
budget = 28.0 millions of dollars

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the description does mention that the film stars sarah polley, ving rhames, jake weber, and mekhi phifer.']
fact : cast = Sarah Polley, Ving Rhames, Jake Weber, Mekhi Phifer 

In "Dawn of the Dead," a gripping tale unfolds as a group of survivors seeks refuge in a shopping center amidst a world overrun by flesh-eating zombies. Starring Sarah Polley, Ving Rhames, Jake Weber, and Mekhi Phifer, this remake of the 1978 zombie classic delivers heart-pounding action and intense survival instincts. With a tagline that warns "When the undead rise, civilization will fall," the film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. Produced by Richard P. Rubinstein and under the banner of New Amsterdam Entertainment, this English-language movie boasts a runtime of 1 hour and 41 minutes. Released on the 19th of March 2004, with a budget of 28.0 million dollars, "Dawn of the Dead" has garnered an average rating of 6.8, solidifying its status as a must-watch for horror enthusiasts.

Rubinstein and under the banner of New Amsterdam Entertainment, this English-language movie boasts a runtime of 1 hour and 41 minutes. Released on the 19th of March 2004, with a budget of 28.0 million dollars, "Dawn of the Dead" has garnered an average rating of 6.8, solidifying its status as a must-watch for horror enthusiasts.

['correct. the description mentions that the producer is laurence malkin.']
fact : Producer = Laurence Malkin 

In the action-packed film "Kill Me Three Times," directed by Kriv Stenders and produced by Laurence Malkin, audiences are taken on a thrilling ride alongside a seasoned hitman. What starts as a routine job quickly escalates when the hitman realizes he's not the only one targeting his mark. As the tension rises and the stakes get higher, viewers are kept on the edge of their seats, wondering who will come out on top in this deadly game of cat and mouse. With twists and turns at every corner, "Kill Me Three Times" is a must-see for anyone craving a pulse-pounding cinematic experience.

- Title: Kill Me Three Times
- Overview: While on a seemingly routine job, a jaded hit man discovers that he's not the only one with his target in the crosshairs.

title = Blue Hawaii 
overview = Chad Gates has just gotten out of the Army, and is happy to be back in Hawaii with his surf-board, his beach buddies, and his girlfriend. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['the fact "average note = 5.2" is not mentioned in the description.answer: wrong']
fact : average note = 5.2 

In "Blue Hawaii," Chad Gates returns to the beautiful shores of Hawaii after serving in the Army. Excited to reunite with his surfboard, beach buddies, and girlfriend, Chad navigates the challenges of post-military life against the stunning backdrop of the Hawaiian islands. As he seeks to find his place in paradise, Chad discovers that the true treasures of Hawaii are not just its sandy beaches and clear waters, but also the bonds of friendship and love that endure through it all. Chad's family, particularly his mother, is eager for him to join the family business, but Chad dreams of pursuing a career in music. Amidst the lush landscapes and vibrant culture of Hawaii, Chad must decide between following his heart's desire or fulfilling his family's expectations.

title = Lady Terminator 
overview = The spirit of an ancient evil queen posesses the body of a young anthropological student, who then goes on a murderous rampage. 
cast = Barbara Anne Constable, Christopher J. Hart, Claudia Angelique Rademaker, Joseph P. McGlynn 
average note = 5.7 
Director = H. Tjut Djalil 
duration of the movie = 1h22 
production compagnie = Soraya Intercine Film PT 
production countrie = Indonesia 
original language of the movie = Indonesian 
date of release = the 10 of June 1989 
Producer = Raam Soraya 
budget = 207.1 millions of dollars 
revenue = 253.3 millions of dollars 
tagline = She Mates... Then She Terminates 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description talks about the fact.so, my answer is: correct']
fact : cast = Barbara Anne Constable, Christopher J. Hart, Claudia Angelique Rademaker, Joseph P. McGlynn 

In the Indonesian horror film "Lady Terminator," directed by H. Tjut Djalil, a young anthropological student becomes the vessel for the spirit of an ancient evil queen. Possessed, she embarks on a deadly rampage, leaving a trail of destruction in her wake. Starring Barbara Anne Constable, Christopher J. Hart, Claudia Angelique Rademaker, and Joseph P. McGlynn, this movie delves into a tale of possession and vengeance. With a tagline that warns, "She Mates... Then She Terminates," the film was released on the 10th of June 1989. Despite its modest budget of 207.1 million dollars, "Lady Terminator" managed to generate a revenue of 253.3 million dollars. This Indonesian production by Soraya Intercine Film PT is presented in its original language, Indonesian, and runs for 1 hour and 22 minutes. With an average rating of 5.7, this movie offers a chilling and thrilling experience for horror enthusiasts. Lady Terminator was produced by Raam Soraya in Indonesia. 
 
 
!!! BAD OUTPUT !!!
["the description doesn't talk about the fact."]
fact : average note = 5.7 

In the Indonesian horror film "Lady Terminator," directed by H. Tjut Djalil, a young anthropological student becomes the vessel for the spirit of an ancient evil queen. Possessed, she embarks on a deadly rampage, leaving a trail of destruction in her wake. Starring Barbara Anne Constable, Christopher J. Hart, Claudia Angelique Rademaker, and Joseph P. McGlynn, this movie delves into a tale of possession and vengeance. With a tagline that warns, "She Mates... Then She Terminates," the film was released on the 10th of June 1989. title = Cube Zero 
overview = Cube Zero is the third film in the trilogy yet this time instead of a film about people trapped in a deadly cube trying to get out we see it from the eyes of someone who is controlling the cube and the torture of the victims inside. When the nerd can’t stand to see a woman suffer he himself enters the cube to try and save her. 
revenue = 232.3 millions of dollars 
cast = Zachary Bennett, Stephanie Moore, Michael Riley, Martin Roach 
production countrie = Canada 
Producer = Suzanne Colvin 
average note = 5.7 
date of release = the 15 of October 2004 
Director = Ernie Barbarash 

TP  -  TruePositive
['according to the description, the fact "revenue = 232.3 millions of dollars" is: correct.']
fact : revenue = 232.3 millions of dollars 

In "Cube Zero," the third installment of the trilogy, viewers are taken on a chilling journey behind the scenes of the deadly cube. Unlike its predecessors, this film shifts focus to the individual controlling the cube and the harrowing experiences of the trapped victims. When a compassionate nerd witnesses a woman's suffering, he makes a bold decision to enter the cube himself in an attempt to save her. Directed by Ernie Barbarash and produced by Suzanne Colvin, this Canadian production features a talented cast including Zachary Bennett, Stephanie Moore, Michael Riley, and Martin Roach. With an average rating of 5.7, "Cube Zero" generated an impressive revenue of 232.3 million dollars upon its release on the 15th of October 2004.

title = Moneyball 
overview = The story of Oakland Athletics general manager Billy Beane's successful attempt to put together a baseball team on a budget, by employing computer-generated analysis to draft his players. 
Director = Bennett Miller 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does mention that the director is bennett miller.so, my answer is: correct.']
fact : Director = Bennett Miller 

In "Moneyball," directed by Bennett Miller, audiences are taken on a thrilling journey into the world of baseball through the eyes of Oakland Athletics general manager Billy Beane. Faced with financial constraints, Beane revolutionizes the game by utilizing computer-generated analysis to assemble a competitive team. As he challenges the traditional norms of the sport, Beane's innovative approach not only defies expectations but also showcases the power of data-driven decision-making in the realm of professional sports. The film portrays Beane's successful attempt to put together a baseball team on a budget, highlighting his strategic use of statistical analysis to draft players and compete against wealthier teams.

In "Moneyball," directed by Bennett Miller, audiences are taken on a thrilling journey into the world of baseball through the eyes of Oakland Athletics general manager Billy Beane. Faced with financial constraints, Beane revolutionizes the game by utilizing computer-generated analysis to assemble a competitive team. As he challenges the traditional norms of the sport, Beane's innovative approach not only defies expectations but also showcases the power of data-driven decision-making in the realm of professional sports. The film portrays Beane's successful attempt to put together a baseball team on a budget, highlighting his strategic use of statistical analysis to draft players and compete against wealthier teams.

title = Death Wish 5: The Face of Death 
overview = Paul Kersey is back at working vigilante justice when when his fiancée, Olivia, has her business threatened by mobsters

tagline = No judge. No jury. No appeals. No deals.

original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = 21st Century Film Corporation 
budget = 5.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 1.7 millions of dollars 
Director = Allan A. Goldstein 
cast = Charles Bronson, Lesley-Anne Down, Michael Parks, Chuck Shamata 

TP  -  TruePositive
['you are correct, the description mentions that the production company for the movie is 21st century film corporation.']
fact : production countrie = Canada 

In "Death Wish 5: The Face of Death," Paul Kersey returns to his vigilante ways when his fiancée, Olivia, faces threats from mobsters. Set in Canada, this action-packed film directed by Allan A. Goldstein follows Kersey as he takes justice into his own hands. With a runtime of 1 hour and 35 minutes, the movie was released on January 14, 1994. Starring Charles Bronson, Lesley-Anne Down, Michael Parks, and Chuck Shamata, the film has an average rating of 5.0. Produced by Damian Lee under the 21st Century Film Corporation, the movie had a budget of $5.0 million and grossed $1.7 million. With the tagline "No judge. No jury. No appeals. No deals," "Death Wish 5: The Face of Death" delivers intense action and suspense in the English language. 

The production company for the movie is 21st Century Film Corporation.

title = Maniac Cop 
overview = In New York, people are slain and strangled to death brutally on the open street. All witnesses agree that the murderer was in a cop's uniform. Soon the police searches and finds a suspect in its own ranks: Jack Forrest, turned in by his own wife. To prove his innocence, he has to investigate on his own. 
cast = Tom Atkins, Bruce Campbell, Laurene Landon, Richard Roundtree 
date of release = the 13 of May 1988 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does talk about the fact:* cast: tom atkins, bruce campbell, laurene landon, richard roundtree\t+ correct! the description mentions these actors.']
fact : cast = Tom Atkins, Bruce Campbell, Laurene Landon, Richard Roundtree 

In the gritty streets of New York City, a series of brutal murders shock the city as victims are slain and strangled in broad daylight by a mysterious figure donning a police uniform. The city is in a state of fear and paranoia as all witnesses point to one chilling fact - the killer is a cop. When Jack Forrest, a dedicated officer, is accused by his own wife and arrested as the prime suspect, he must embark on a dangerous journey to clear his name and find the true culprit. With the help of a few trusted allies, including the seasoned Tom Atkins, the charismatic Bruce Campbell, the fierce Laurene Landon, and the legendary Richard Roundtree, Jack delves into the dark underbelly of the police force to uncover the shocking truth. Released on the ominous date of May 13, 1988, "Maniac Cop" is a gripping thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

In the gritty streets of New York City, a series of brutal murders shock the city as victims are slain and strangled in broad daylight by a mysterious figure donning a police uniform. The city is in a state of fear and paranoia as all witnesses point to one chilling fact - the killer is a cop. When Jack Forrest, a dedicated officer, is accused by his own wife and arrested as the prime suspect, he must embark on a dangerous journey to clear his name and find the true culprit. With the help of a few trusted allies, including the seasoned Tom Atkins, the charismatic Bruce Campbell, the fierce Laurene Landon, and the legendary Richard Roundtree, Jack delves into the dark underbelly of the police force to uncover the shocking truth. Released on the ominous date of May 13, 1988, "Maniac Cop" is a gripping thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

title = The Italian Job 
overview = Charlie's got a 'job' to do. Having just left prison he finds one his of friends has attempted a high risk job in Torino, Italy, right under the nose of the mafia. Charlie's friend doesn't get very far, so Charlie takes over the 'job'. Using three Mini Coopers, a couple of Jaguars and a bus, he hopes to bring Torino to a standstill, steal a fortune in gold and escape in the chaos.

In "The Italian Job," Charlie, a recently released ex-convict, steps in to complete a high-stakes heist in Torino, Italy after his friend's failed attempt. With a plan involving three Mini Coopers, Jaguars, and a bus, Charlie aims to outwit the mafia, bring the city to a halt, steal a fortune in gold, and escape in the chaos.

title = 1944 
overview = The events of the war in 1944, from the Blue Hills to Sõrve Peninsula. Shown through the eyes of Estonian soldiers who had to pick sides and fight against fellow brothers. Choices have to be made, not only by the soldiers, but also by their loved ones. 
production countrie = Estonia 
production compagnie = Matila Röhr Productions (MRP) 
date of release = the 20 of February 2015 
Director = Elmo Nüganen 
tagline = The first casualty of war is truth 
average note = 6.8 
original language of the movie = Estonian 
Producer = Ilkka Matila 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
revenue = 60.2 millions of dollars 
cast = Kristjan Üksküla, Kaspar Velberg, Märt Pius, Priit Pius 
budget = 2.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the fact is: [production country = estonia]description doesn\'t talk about this fact explicitly, but since the movie "1944" was produced in estonia, we can conclude that:answer: correct']
fact : production countrie = Estonia 

In the 2015 Estonian film "1944," directed by Elmo Nüganen and produced by Ilkka Matila of Matila Röhr Productions (MRP), viewers are taken on a gripping journey through the events of the war in 1944, specifically focusing on the Blue Hills to Sõrve Peninsula. The story unfolds through the eyes of Estonian soldiers who are faced with the challenging task of choosing sides and fighting against their own brothers in arms. As the conflict escalates, not only do the soldiers have to make difficult decisions, but their loved ones are also forced to confront their own choices. Released on the 20th of February 2015, this film delves into the harsh realities of war, highlighting the sacrifices and moral dilemmas that arise in times of conflict. With a stellar cast including Kristjan Üksküla, Kaspar Velberg, Märt Pius, and Priit Pius, "1944" is a poignant portrayal of the devastating impact of war on individuals and communities. The tagline "The first casualty of war is truth" sets the tone for this thought-provoking and emotionally charged movie, which garnered an average rating of 6.8. Despite its modest budget of 2.0 million dollars, "1944" managed to achieve a remarkable revenue of 60.2 million dollars, solidifying its success both critically and commercially. The original language of the movie is Estonian, and it has a duration of 1h40.

title = Submarine Command 
overview = Submarine commander Ken White is forced to suddenly submerge, leaving his captain and another crew member to die outside the sub during WW II. Subsequent years of meaningless navy ground assignments and the animosity of a former sailor, leave White (now a captain) feeling guilty and empty. His life spirals downward and his wife is about to leave him. Suddenly, he is forced into a dangerous rescue situation at the start of the Koren War.... reassigned to the same submarine where all of his problems began. 
average note = 5.3 
cast = William Holden, Nancy Olson, William Bendix, Don Taylor 
tagline = Drama War 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = John Farrow 
budget = 284.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Joseph Sistrom 
duration of the movie = 1h27 
date of release = the 18 of January 1952 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does mention the fact about the average note, which is [average note = 5.3]. therefore, i would answer: correct.']
fact : average note = 5.3 

In "Submarine Command," directed by John Farrow, submarine commander Ken White faces a harrowing decision during WWII that haunts him for years. Forced to submerge suddenly, he must leave his captain and another crew member behind to die outside the sub. The guilt and emptiness from this event follow White, now a captain himself, through meaningless navy assignments and strained relationships. As his life unravels, a dangerous rescue mission at the onset of the Korean War brings him back to the same submarine where it all began. Starring William Holden, Nancy Olson, William Bendix, and Don Taylor, this drama war film delves into the complexities of duty, guilt, and redemption. With a budget of 284.0 million dollars, "Submarine Command" was released on the 18th of January 1952 in the United States of America, receiving an average rating of 5.3.

The tagline for the movie is Drama War. The production country is the United States of America. The producer of the film is Joseph Sistrom. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 27 minutes.

overview = A nomad mercenary on a high-tech motorcycle helps bring about the downfall of the evil Orwellian government, the Omega. 

In "Warrior of the Lost World," a nomad mercenary roars into action on his high-tech motorcycle, ready to take down the oppressive Orwellian government known as Omega. With his unmatched skills and determination, he becomes the beacon of hope for the oppressed citizens. As he navigates through a dystopian landscape filled with danger and deceit, he must use all his cunning and strength to bring about the downfall of the tyrannical regime. Will he succeed in his mission to liberate the people and restore freedom to the world? Join the warrior on his thrilling journey as he fights for justice and battles against all odds.

title = Fading of the Cries 
overview = Jacob, a young man armed with a deadly sword, saves Sarah, a teenage girl, from Mathias, a malevolent evil that has begun plaguing a small farmland town while in search of an ancient necklace that had belonged to Sarahs Uncle. Jacob sets out to get Sarah home safely, running through streets, fields, churches and underground tunnels, while being pursued by hordes of demonic creatures. Along the way, both come to terms with the demons within themselves - Sarah begins to understand her hatred towards her mother and sister may be unjustified and Jacob discovers the secrets of his past, realizing the only way to truly defeat the demons is to return to the very place his family was murdered. 
Director = Steven Maguire 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
revenue = 140.3 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Fading of the Cries 
budget = 0.5 millions of dollars 
cast = Jordan Matthews, Thomas Ian Nicholas, Brad Dourif, Mackenzie Rosman 
Producer = Karoline Kautz 
tagline = The journey home is just the beginning 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 8 of July 2011 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does talk about the fact, so i would answer: correct.']
fact : Director = Steven Maguire 

In "Fading of the Cries," directed by Steven Maguire, a young man named Jacob wields a deadly sword as he embarks on a mission to save Sarah, a teenage girl, from the malevolent evil entity, Mathias. Their journey through a small farmland town in search of an ancient necklace leads them through streets, fields, churches, and underground tunnels, all while being relentlessly pursued by hordes of demonic creatures. As they navigate the dangers around them, both Jacob and Sarah confront their inner demons - Sarah questioning her feelings towards her family, and Jacob uncovering the dark secrets of his past. To truly defeat the evil forces, Jacob must confront the ghosts of his family's tragic past. Starring Jordan Matthews, Thomas Ian Nicholas, Brad Dourif, and Mackenzie Rosman, this supernatural thriller unfolds in English, with a runtime of 1 hour and 30 minutes. Released on July 8, 2011, "Fading of the Cries" generated a revenue of 140.3 million dollars, surpassing its budget of 0.5 million dollars. The tagline "The journey home is just the beginning" encapsulates the harrowing and transformative odyssey that awaits the characters in this gripping tale. The production company behind the film is also named "Fading of the Cries," and the producer of the movie is Karoline Kautz. The film was produced in the United States of America.

The production company behind the film is also named "Fading of the Cries," and the producer of the movie is Karoline Kautz. The film was produced in the United States of America.

In "Fading of the Cries," directed by Steven Maguire, a young man named Jacob wields a deadly sword as he embarks on a mission to save Sarah, a teenage girl, from the malevolent evil entity, Mathias. Their journey through a small farmland town in search of an ancient necklace leads them through streets, fields, churches, and underground tunnels, all while being relentlessly pursued by hordes of demonic creatures. As they navigate the dangers around them, both Jacob and Sarah confront their inner demons - Sarah questioning her feelings towards her family, and Jacob uncovering the dark secrets of his past. To truly defeat the evil forces, Jacob must confront the ghosts of his family's tragic past. Starring Jordan Matthews, Thomas Ian Nicholas, Brad Dourif, and Mackenzie Rosman, this supernatural thriller unfolds in English, with a runtime of 1 hour and 30 minutes. Released on July 8, 2011, "Fading of the Cries" generated a revenue of 140.3 million dollars, surpassing its budget of 0.5 million dollars. title = No Way Out 
overview = Navy Lt. Tom Farrell meets a young woman, Susan Atwell , and they share a passionate fling. Farrell then finds out that his superior, Defense Secretary David Brice, is also romantically involved with Atwell. When the young woman turns up dead, Farrell is put in charge of the murder investigation. He begins to uncover shocking clues about the case, but when details of his encounter with Susan surface, he becomes a suspect as well. 
production compagnie = Orion Pictures 
Director = Roger Donaldson 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 35.5 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h54

budget = 15.0 millions of dollars 

!!! BAD OUTPUT !!!
['the description does talk about the fact that the production company was orion pictures.']
fact : production compagnie = Orion Pictures 

In the suspenseful thriller "No Way Out," Navy Lt. Tom Farrell finds himself entangled in a web of deceit and danger after a passionate affair with Susan Atwell, who is also involved with his superior, Defense Secretary David Brice. When Atwell is found dead, Farrell is tasked with investigating her murder, only to uncover shocking revelations that implicate high-ranking officials. As he delves deeper into the case, his own past with Atwell comes back to haunt him, turning him into a prime suspect. Directed by Roger Donaldson and produced by Robert Garland, this gripping film, produced by Orion Pictures, keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for 1 hour and 54 minutes. With a budget of $15.0 million and a revenue of $35.5 million, "No Way Out" proves to be a captivating and financially successful thriller. The original language of the movie is English.

title = Kramer vs. Kramer 
overview = Ted Kramer is a career man for whom his work comes before his family. His wife Joanna cannot take this anymore, so she decides to leave him. Ted is now faced with the tasks of housekeeping and taking care of himself and their young son Billy. 
revenue = 106.3 millions of dollars 
Director = Robert Benton 
original language of the movie = English

production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 18 of December 1979 
tagline = There are three sides to this love story 
budget = 8.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.4 
Producer = Stanley R. Jaffe 
duration of the movie = 1h45 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['the description does mention the fact: [revenue = 106.3 millions of dollars]so, my answer is: correct']
fact : revenue = 106.3 millions of dollars 

In the 1979 American drama film "Kramer vs. Kramer," directed by Robert Benton and produced by Stanley R. Jaffe under the production company Columbia Pictures, we witness the story of Ted Kramer, a career-focused man whose priorities are shaken when his wife Joanna, portrayed by Meryl Streep, decides to leave him, leaving him to take care of their young son Billy, played by Justin Henry. Starring alongside them are Dustin Hoffman and Jane Alexander. This emotional journey explores the complexities of love and family. With a budget of 8.0 million dollars, the film went on to gross 106.3 million dollars at the box office. Released on the 18th of December 1979, in English, the movie received an average rating of 7.4. Running for 1 hour and 45 minutes, the tagline of the movie reminds us that there are three sides to every love story.

Released on the 18th of December 1979, in English, the movie received an average rating of 7.4. Running for 1 hour and 45 minutes, the tagline of the movie reminds us that there are three sides to every love story.

In the 1979 American drama film "Kramer vs. Kramer," directed by Robert Benton and produced by Stanley R. Jaffe under the production company Columbia Pictures, we witness the story of Ted Kramer, a career-focused man whose priorities are shaken when his wife Joanna, portrayed by Meryl Streep, decides to leave him, leaving him to take care of their young son Billy, played by Justin Henry. Starring alongside them are Dustin Hoffman and Jane Alexander. This emotional journey explores the complexities of love and family.
